description: This is one of our favorite restaurants in San Francisco. We come here all the time and always try something new on the menu! The menu rotates and it's delicious. They gave a good wine selection too. My fiance spilled and broke a glass of wine all over the table and floor and the staff were so kind and helpful!!
author: Shannon C.

description:
This place is so cute! It's a little small, but the vibe is great. They don't have a huge wine selection for being a wine bar, but I did really enjoy the Pinot Bianco I got. I ordered the Spanish octopus gnocchi , and I really enjoyed it! I'm a huge octopus fan right now, so to be fair, I would probably like any dish with octopus. It wasn't rubbery at all and was really tender. The gnocchi was okay. It was a little too soft for my liking, but the dish as a whole was pretty good. The other good thing about here is that they make all of their pastas in-house which is always a plus! We also ordered the panna cotta which I really enjoyed! It was perfectly creamy and delicious. 

The only downside was that the waitress we had wasn't super friendly, but she did give us a lot of menu suggestions!
author: Frannie Y.

description:
YES to the sexy, artsy, wine-centric, music-centric vibe at 20 Spot. The lighting is perfectly low & glowy. The music & wine is always thoughtfully curated. It's my ideal SF date night because it feels lively any night of the week, and casual enough to drop in and grab a seat the bar, lounge area, or communal tables. 

For wine & small bites, it's solid. Mid-range prices. But main courses can be hit or miss. I once had an incredible gnocchi here, and then had a super disappointing $20 octopus "paella" (more like fried rice). The avocado toast is pretty unique, with halibut ceviche. 

Oh, and service -- so so cool and unpretentious. Always on top of it, accommodating, and happy to pour little tastes of wine before deciding. 

I've been recommending 20 Spot to all my wine-loving friends looking for a chill, sultry, low-key date night.
author: Nique F.

description:
This spot is an absolute gem; artsy yet edgy, romantic yet casual. There's a nice lounge vibe which is perfect to bring a date or just have a girls night out. 

My two girlfriends and I loved all the food we got, but dear baby jesus, can we talk about the crab mac and cheese which is RIDICULOUSLY delicious. It's cheesy, crabby, and carb-y, just everything you want in your mouth. I would come back just for that. We got the kale salad so we would feel less guilty. Highly recommend both.
author: Cindy A.

description: It's a cool little joint.  Some groovy art. Hard to spot from the signage. Nice staff.  Went for a glass of wine and enjoyed hanging on the couch and watching the crowd. Would like to go back some day and try the food
author: Rich P.

description:
This place is hella small- it is a trendy place but not my first choice. 

I want to have convo - i can hear what they say on the other end of the wall - 
Limited menu - and if it's a slow night then this is spot to be otherwise - not my first choice
author: Victor D.

description:
Tucked away on a corner of 20th Street in the Mission, 20 Spot is a beer and wine bar with a solid menu of bistro fare that rotates seasonally.

I'm currently catching up on Yelp reviews and I notice that they're currently offering a duck confit entrée which is slightly different from the one I had at this time last year. My version came with bourbon-poached cherries, polenta, and asparagus. It was a decently prepared and presented dish, and it was then quite reasonably priced ($17). It was also a good way to soak up a couple of their wines; here, they've got pretty much all the varietals covered, whether my own favorites like gruner veltliner, riseling, pinot noir, or cabernet franc.

The vibe is laid-back and casual, as the inside sort of feels like someone's living room, right down to music coming from a record player. Service was merely perfunctory, as it was obviously skewed towards regulars. Overall, a good neighborhood venue to try various wines by the glass and grab some decent food while you're at it.
author: Vincent L.

description:
20 Spot is more than just a wine bar, it is a pretty legit restaurant. They serve more than just bar/finger food.. although I haven't gotten a chance to try many of the dishes.

The place is pretty small and cozy, and it has a cool/hip ambiance. The food that I tried here were pretty good and the wine were reasonably priced. 

We had the tuna poke served on top of crispy seaweed, which was pretty tasty. When we were there, they were serving $1.50 oyster, which was a good deal but I'm not sure if it's always $1.50 or just that day. We also had the roasted asparagus; it was served with some creamy sauce and it was seasoned nicely. The cheese plate was pretty good too; it came with 3 different cheeses (one soft and two semi-soft cheeses) and served with perfectly crisp crostini, honey, pickled veggies, candied mixed nuts and some marmalade... not bad for $20 and definitely good for sharing.

I will definitely be back to try other dishes in their menu.
author: Sam M.

description: I came here for the first time last night and really enjoyed the vibe. I've found the wine bars usually excel in either a unique selection of wines OR delicious food, but it's hard to find a place that can master both. I was pleasantly surprised that 20 Spot not only had a great wine selection but also some of the tastiest apps I've had in awhile. Added bonus was the friendly and helpful staff. I'll be back!
author: Mia G.

description: Came here on a Friday night with friends for wine & snacks. This is a cute small wine bar and serve  seasonal dishes. They have a decent selection of wine and other alcohol. We got a bottle of Cab and we really liked it. The wine was full body and rich in taste. Recommend for cozy sf late night wine bar!
author: Clare L.

description: This place has the most unbelievable avocado toast EVER. It comes with halibut ceviche on top, which is a very novel way to do avocado toast, in my opinion. And the bread part has just the perfect degree of crunch in its toastiness--so delicious. My friend and I were so blown away we asked for a second order. And when we finished that one, we contemplated getting yet another one. Definitely coming back for this fantastic avocado toast! Thank you, 20 Spot!
author: Lissette C.

description: What an incredible find! This hidden gem in the Mission was suggested to me by my niece, and it was a nice surprise. Small space but with an artistic vibe and remnants of its former record store days. Food and wine selection is pretty decent. The bread with radish butter is a real highlight, as was the heirloom tomato salad and roasted cauliflower.
author: Suzie A.

description: Very cute, intimate setting and simple menu. We ordered the deviled eggs, avocado toast, octopus paella, and beef tartar. Best item was the avocado toast, it come topped with flavorful, perfectly seasoned halibut. Slightly disappointed in the beef tartar, it was overly spiced with mustard and lacked salt. Other than that, this is a nice place, perfect for dinner for two.
author: Angel K.

description: Cozy spot with attentive bartenders - came by on a Tuesday night so it was just the right amount of people but could see how it can get packed during busier times. Recommend the Cabernet franc - the crudo was a little too fishy for my taste.
author: Joanna L.

description: The bare reflection of the owner, his vibe, his style, his music selection and an exceptionally curated, international wine list.  And for the cozy kitchen in the back, they put out some pretty stellar dishes.   It can get pretty packed, and the energy is always incredible.   Bodhi is a true badass.
author: Lance H.

description: Very attentive bartender. Wine selection is broad. Food selection is slim picking but solid. If you want a hearty meal this may not be the place to go. But the ambiance is great. Never really too crowded or busy for a walk in at the bar on a week day night.
author: Alice W.

description:
This is a great little corner spot for wine in the Mission. It's a little loud, but if there are just two of you, still easy to have a conversation.  The wine selection is decent, staff is nice, and the record selection is excellent. They will seat you when you arrive and have several communal tables.

The banana cream pie was a little underwhelming but the wine was good. It's a great option to grab a drink with a friend.
author: Rachel R.

description: Small, quaint and relaxing wine bar that a good friend introduced me to.  Great wine selection and friendly service.  The food however really stands out here, and I feel guilty saying that 20 Spot may make one of the best avocado toasts.  Yes it's $16, yes it clearly is the poster child of gentrification gone wrong, but with Halibut ceviche, cilantro, and lemon mixed with the avocado, it makes it worthy of a second order along with a nice bottle of Chardonnay.
author: MJ A.

description:
Stopped here on a Saturday night with a friend to grab a drink before dinner at Central Kitchen.

This rating is only for drinks, service, and ambiance.

I found the wine selection boring.  You're a wine bar....please offer patrons more wine options....*sigh*

Service was ok but neither warm nor inviting which is weird since this place is tiny and can easily foster a warmer environment if the staff made an effort.  But I suppose the staff are too cool for school given the hip location.

Would return if friends wanted to meet here but would not choose it myself.
author: Lev E.

description: This place is a great place.  Awesome bartender and great vibe.   The food was really good as well
author: Marc L.

description:
20 spot is the perfect name for it, it's a cool little spot tucked away at the quiet corner of 20th and Lexington, right between the busy main drags of Valencia and Mission. 

In what used to be a record store (remember those? sad face), it still keeps that musical charm with some great music bumping over the speakers in this railroad car-sized venue. There are still choice cuts of vinyl in the shelves behind the bar area, which reinforces the mood that you're not in a conventional wine bar or restaurant.

The menu is all eclectic modern American small plates. We had the deviled eggs (solid), crab toast (very tasty), winter panzanella salad (epic), and the sausage and ricotta flat bread (very tasty).  Not a disappointment in the bunch.

Service was prompt and friendly, no complaints.  Definitely will return.
author: Saminda W.

description:
I mean, whahtevs. 

I'm not into the hipster wine-bar groove, sorry.  My first thought walking in there, "this place smells like throw-up".  Seriously.  Some nasty whiffs I got when I stepped in this joint last night.

It's sort of cool-ish concept done hipster-style.  I felt like they decorated with a bunch of stuff they picked up at garage sales, or free stuff people had given away.  If I'm in the Mission on Lexington with no way to walk anywhere else and I just HAVE to have a freaking glass of wine, I guess I'd come here.  But to me it was like a cross between a dive bar and a wine bar.  They've got a (not-so-loungy) couch area, a bar, a few flimsy communal tables, and here's the rest:
---
PROS:
Yes, the wine pours are generous.
Just enough variety on the wine list.
Bread and butter is good - nothing special, but generous and good.
----
CONS
*To me, the food kinda sucks.  Olives are hard and flavorless.  Cheese plate looks a mess. And one of the cheese they served to me yesterday was rotten.  

*Tables are flimsy and cheap, have no room, and once someone sits next to you, you'll feel claustrophobic.

*Wait staff is a little flippant.

*If you're looking for a nice-ish wine bar, this aint the place.

*And last call for food at 11pm?  GURL BYE!
-------
I really wanted to like this place.  And believe me, I always loves mi wine, but if I really wanted to go somewhere cool, I'd pop into ABV instead.
author: Angella S.

description:
I can't imagine a place in this city that I would rather spend several hours drinking interesting wine selections with delicious food pairings. Hospitality is second to none, and I would definitely recommend asking your server what they're interested in, or what's fun tonight, or just spilling your guts at them and finding out what wine matches your guts perfectly.

AND THEY PLAY REAL ASS RECORDS. 

what's not to love?
author: Elliot E.

description:
I will start with the fact that I really wanted to like this place! Sadly, I did not. Firstly, the music, which ate up all the air in room, sounded like repetitive nails on a chalkboard. Secondly, the food was nowhere near the caliber of its photos or its sticker price. The octopus dish was saltier than the Mediterranean, the poke was swimming in tomatoes and diced so small I wondered if it was even on the plate, and the squash was so peppery I drank half my bottle of water just to assuage the taste! Don't waste your time or money!

PS- The waitress was kind and attentive, and this is why I am not rating it a one.
author: Marisol H.

description:
Caveat: granted, there was no crab pot or hamachi on the menu...clearly crowd faves. Neither was the cauliflower being served last night.

A very fair 2.5 for a dinner that was unmemorable. $83 for 2 people, 2 glasses of white (averaging $13/ glass), and 3 starter/small plates. Portions are quite small. Come with a tiny appetite or else be prepared to drop over $100 for a party of 2 for mediocre vittles.

The service: meh. Server was not conscientious in checking in with us, save to clear plates and ask whether we wanted to add cheese plate and/or dessert. We didn't find him too concerned. 

In short, deviled eggs. Longed for the flavor to be even deeper, even with the umami- seafood atop. Burrata was the best in flavor of the 3 plates. Like the seasoning on the baby arugula, crostini toasted properly.

Last of all, tartare. Where was the unctuousness, the silky fresh egg and the bright flavor of fresh beef? Didn't agree with the cut of the tartare. It ate not right with the texture in the mouth. Also felt that it needed more flavor,

Both dining mates decently well-eaten folk. Sadly, we couldn't say we would ever return, save to partake of a glass at the very cool, retro bar. It's the property that seems to make this place, at least for me and my first dining experience here.
author: Jana C.

description:
Giving my favorite local hangout 5 stars because its all that.
Please don't ruin it my mobbing it all at once, it special the way it is.
author: Simon S.

description:
3 stars, "A-OK" as Yelp says.

20 Spot is fairly cozy and cute inside. Location is a bit tucked away, although not rocket science to find. Service was decent - not great, a bit on the slow side, but not terrible. The wine was pretty good, as were the prices.

All-around, I'd just use the word "decent," which is pretty darn similar to Yelp's "A-OK."

Not a place to run away from, and not a place to run to.
author: Nic Z.

description: Wonderful neighborhood spot with excellent service and really nice wait staff!!
author: Frank S.

description: Really great food and wine. It's very small so get there early if possible because it gets very busy. We were all very happy with the food and wine selection.
author: Molly O.

description:
I've been here a couple times. 

On a weekday night, it's fairly quiet here so it's a good spot to catch up with someone / have a drink / date spot. 

On the weekend, it's must busier and might be harder to snag a table; however, it's still not as busy as one would expect 

+ nice waiters with good wine recommendations
+/- cheese plate - standard blue cheese, brie and cheddar variety; none of the cheese stood out
- doesn't take reservations
author: Margaret R.

description: Very nice ambiance in this cool place.  Very cozy, relaxed, and romantic.  Not the best wine selection or appetizers choice though.
author: Thomas P. L.

description: This is a cozy cute restaurant. Not many tables so not sure if it is good for groups. The steak tartare was good and we also enjoyed the wine menu
author: Suna L.

description:
As promised, came back to actually enjoy a glass of wine. Or in this case, a glass and a half. Love anyplace that let's a customer order in increments.

Generous pours, that's for sure. And very helpful guys behind the counter who let you taste a bit before deciding on a varietal. 

When can I come back and pick the record playing???
author: Abby S.

description:
What a lovely wine bar.  I heart you, 20 spot :)

My husband and I were so happy to have found this place.  You would think SF being so close to wine country and being a city that loves its wine, that there would be excellent wine bars litered throughout every neighborhood.  While there are definitely certain "gems," unfortunately there are too many "meh" spots that leave you disappointed.  Not the case with this neighborhood gem.

I had stumbled upon it and "book-marked it" as a "must-go at some point," but just never got around to it.  Until earlier this month, and now it is on the short list of "where should we go for dinner tonight."  Needless to say, I believe we will become regulars at this spot...

FOOD: 

Our first time in, we went with another couple.  We had some cheese/charcuterie at our place before stopping in, so we decided just to do a few things to share.  Here's what we tried:

Della Bread Plate (4 stars) - Wasn't expecting much with this; we opted to get it just so we had something to munch on while we waited for our other items to arrive. Well, were we blown away.  The bread was simply delicious.  Fresh, warm, and chewy - came with a variety of breads, and all were delicious.  The butter it came with was yummy as well; loved the addition of sea salt (love me some salted buttah!!).

Coconut Milk Ceviche (5 stars) - This dish was one of my favorites - perhaps THE favorite of the night in my opinion.  The fish was so fresh, and the sauce/ingredients accompany offered so much flavor and the perfect amount of texture.  Yum - definitely recommend this dish.

Potted Rabbit (4.5 stars) - Decadent, flavorful, creamy.  Was actually expecting not to be much of a fan, but I was blown away by this dish and couldn't stop myself for going for seconds.

Grilled Octopus (5 stars) - My husband and I love octopus when it's done correctly - but it's always a gamble, because some places just don't execute it correctly.  This dish was perfectly cooked; crispy at the tips, yet soft throughout (no rubbery, tough texture like you can get when it's over cooked or gooey/flabby texture if under-done).  And the fennel salad and sauces that accompanied the octopus rounded out the entire dish.  One of our favorite dishes of the night - huge hit with all of us.

WINE: 

Three of us (including myself) decided to do the wine flight - so glad we did that.  My husband opted to go for the sparkling rose (but was a bit jealous of our wine selections once they came!)  The wines included in the flight were impeccable.  You could tell that whoever selected the wine really know what they're doing.  Later we found out that the owner of 20 spot is actually the owner of Bacchus Wine Bar on Hyde Street in Russian Hill (close to Elephant Sushi): http://www.yelp.com/biz/bacchus-wine-bar-san-francisco.

Bacchus was one of our favorite wine bars in Russian Hill, offering a great selection of quality wines.  No surprise that 20 spot offers the same - a wonderful selection of quality wines at reasonable prices.

We had such a wonderful experience the first time, my husband and I made the decision right then and there that we would be back soon.  Aaaand, less than a week later, we were stopped in again.  This time we chose to sit at the bar, and ended up meeting the owner who was working behind the bar that night.  Such a friendly guy - it was so nice to chat with him.  He was also very generous with the wine, offering generous servings of those we ordered, and offering an "extra" pour of another red toward the end of the meal.  As with last time, every wine we tried was amazing.  For the food the second time around, we decided to do the cheese plate for 2, the ceviche, and one other "main" item (though it's slipped my mind what we actually ordered!).  All of the food was once again, amazing.  

We were out of town the last couple of weeks, and while we kept saying "I can't wait to go back to 20 Spot when we get back!" :)  We will definitely be in again soon, and I highly recommend stopping in.  Definitely recommend for a quiet/intimate dinner spot, but would also be great for a pre-dinner/post-dinner glass of wine or snack.
author: Rachael S.

description: Great spot to hang out with friends. they incorrectly charged my credit card by about a dollar extra, and I wrote a review of it. The manager reached out to me and took the initiative to rectify the charge, so it's only fair if I update my review to reflect their honesty!
author: Yoon P.

description:
20 Spot is a wine bar. I have never been to a wine bar. Wine seems to be the thing in San Francisco. 

20 Spot was cool and laid back. Unassuming from outside, this is a small wine bar with decent space for a group of friends to enjoy a night out. They have bar seating and a couple smaller tables. All other tables give the feel of community style as they are tightly spaced along the wall. There was still a good amount of privacy, it simply felt more homey than your typical bar setup. 

We had a few glasses of wine and some bread a cheese. The bartender helped us and was friendly. We actually sat on the couches and love seat that were available and used the small coffee table.

I believe the music here was all via records and was "DJ'd" by the bartender. Selections were classical greats, some Big Papa made it into them mix, and the volume made it a loud experience. This is just a note, nothing negative. There were some lulls in-between music selections but somehow this worked out. The breaks were never too long and picked up just at the right time.

20 Spot hit the spot and was a surprising first experience at a bar like this. Definitely worth the try if you are a millennial and love wine.
author: Rawlins R.

description:
Cute spot in the Mission for a glass of wine or a romantic dinner before going out to the bars down the street.

The servers/bartenders are friendly and knowledgeable. There's not a good place to sit with a group over drinks, but we took over the couch area by the front of the place and it worked well for our group of four.
author: Leana L.

description: cool place super mellow. good service. good wine list. decent prices. mainly small tight table seating. score the couches in the front if you can
author: Christine L.

description:
With all the 5 star reviews, I really expected better. My two girlfriends and I came here for dinner. Their menu is relatively small and changes daily. Their items are also meant for sharing. We ended up ordering 5 things. 

Della fattoria bread plate (2.5/5): 3 chunks of bread, butter, radish, and cucumbers. There was no excitement with this bread plate. ($5)

Devilled eggs (3.5/5): The eggs were simple but tasty. The roe gave them a nice flavor. Was hoping that there would be more than just 4 eggs. Accompanied by mini pickles and cucumbers. ($10)

Rainbow carrot salad (4/5): Rainbow carrots roasted and pureed in a salad. It was nice to try carrots that were prepared differently. ($13)

Coconut milk ceviche (3/5): Served in a small bowl with tortilla rounds. Refreshing dish but not too many pieces of fish. ($15) 

Grilled octopus (3/5): Grilled octopus with potato and fennel. It was okay. More potato and fennel than octopus. ($18)

Overall, an average meal. None of the items we had stood out. Also, the portions were tiny for sharing. Definitely not worth the price.
author: Marti L.

description:
This place is an absolute GEM from the adorable corner space itself to the staff, food, wine and lastly, the music. The vibe feels so great in this place and if you are going on a date, this would be the spot to impress. 
The wine selection is in its own league and the pizza.... It was honestly the very best pizza my boyfriend and I have had in SF. The dough and ricotta were perfection. The flavor and texture was orgasmic. Taste buds blown away.
They make their own ricotta and dough for their pizza AND they also make a garlic radish butter from the garlic they grow in their garden. For me, it is the little things right down to the butter that I love and damn, even 20 Spot's butter is the best I've ever had!
author: Erin L.

description:
This is a romantic and charming little wine bar with a solid (and reasonably priced) selection of wines. Although we didn't taste any of the food, my friends and I enjoyed splitting a bottle of red late at night while listening to some great tunes. They even print out their playlist on the menu, which was kind of quirky and fun. The decor is very eclectic as well. 

Our waitress was sweet but left us alone for the most part, which was fine since we were just drinking and not ordering food. I had a lovely time and would recommend it for a date or small group gathering.
author: Valerie L.

description:
Love the vibe, the food is awesome, the wine selections are ridiculously fabulous, and the people working here are just the coolest.

We came by last weekend and had the best time.  The restaurant is dim and sort of hipster/romantic, and they (true to their sign outside) play records all night long - the daily menu lists the records they'll be playing, but they also went "off-book" while we were there.  The folks working there are super friendly and really knowledgeable - it was fun to talk shop with them about different wineries and varietals.

The food was really impressive.  Not just for a "wine bar," but in general.  It's pretty much vegetarian, which is cool - my meat-loving boyfriend said he could be a vegetarian if it meant eating like this all the time!  The only non-vegetarian item was the raw oysters - which were great.  Big and briny :)  We also had the clay pot asparagus, cast iron radishes (woah - turned me into a radish-lover!), snap peas, and chocolate avocado pudding.  Everything was awesome.  I could elaborate, but it would probably be too much.  Every flavor was spot on (appropriate given the wine bar name!).

The wine list was also fantastic.  We had stopped by Lark and Blush in Castro earlier in the night and had been uniformly disappointed - U.S. / California wines were very underrepresented, and the selection of Italian/French wines were pretty pedestrian.  At 20 Spot, they have tons of trailblazing U.S. winemakers on their menu (Donkey & Goat, Broc Cellars, etc) and then they have super unique foreign options, like an amazing Chardonnay/Posip/Pinot Grigio blend from a Croatian winery named Bibich.

I can't wait to return!
author: Tay H.

description:
Uncomfortable vibes. 

What led to uncomfortable vibes? Waitstaff, bartender, bleh wine, ok food for somewhat steep prices. It's a hole in the wall that is not worth recommending. My husband saw an old episode of Check Please that made him curious but I think we're good now.
author: Crystal S.

description: Amazing cozy place,  nice staff, great music, decent prices, but not cheap. Good selections of wine nothing too crazy. Good little bites, would go back sometime!
author: Enrique G.

description:
Definitely a fan of 20 Spot! I really like how everything is set up in the restaurant from the interior perspective. It's a dressy/casual spot and a great atmosphere with some intimate lighting. It's a perfect date spot too! Not just the food was great but the servers/hostess too! 

I ordered the Syrah blend wine which was great temperature! Two thumbs up for that! I ordered the deviled eggs which had a kick to it! The shaved asparagus and fennel salad was really refreshing and light. I enjoyed the cheese plate as well but I wish they had options of meat plate which they don't offer. Oysters were fresh and delicious!! I would also recommend getting the crab pot as well. I would definitely come back here again!
author: Jenn L.

description:
Probably my favorite wine bar in the Mission. The ambiance is dark, with couches and tables, so it can feel more intimate or friendly depending on what you're going for.

I just ordered a single glass of the Trig Point Cabernet Sauvignon which was great. If you like bold reds, this is your wine. I didn't order the food, but it looks yummy.

20 Spot is on the pricier side for wine bars, but worth it to experience the atmosphere, good service, and quality wine.
author: Emmy Q.

description:
Amaz-a-balls!!!  Here for the first time and love the wine selection, the food (so fresh and tasty), and most importantly the staff are fun, knowledgeable and generous.  
Fabulous music too.
author: Sharon L.

description:
what to order: octopus gnocchi and pork belly dish
tip: call ahead to check for the wait, small place with not many tables

What a cute little wine restaurant! Perfect for a date or catch-up session. The restaurant is dark and the tables are very close to each other but the decor and feel is very cute and romantic. When my bestfriend and I first got seated, I was hesitant we would be able to have any meaningful conversations because of how close we were to the other tables. However, since everyone is having their own intimate conversations, you don't hear other conversations.

We ordered the:
Arugula salad- ok, tasty but not super impressive
Pork belly dish- which comes with rice, pickled veggies and some greens, the pork belly is DELICIOUS. like a nice thick flavorful cut of bacon! so good. 
Octopus gnocchi- definitely my favorite! the octopus was so flavorful, slightly chewy but in the best of ways. and the gnocchi! YUM so gooey and delicious. We ate every piece!

A little pricey for my peasant income but I would come back for a special occasion.
author: Thuy-Vy N.

description: Had a lovely evening here.  Great atmosphere, good wine selection, yummy bites.  Look forward to coming back to check out the desserts.  My only criticism, the music was a little loud.
author: Mark N.

description:
"CUTE"
(4.25 stars)

Wines that you cannot pronounce and are not from this country... are usually the best!!!

-FOOD, yummy
-PRICES, fair
-SERVICE, good
-AMBIANCE, "cute"

That's the only way I can really describe this place... "cute". I think by the end of my review, you will hate the word "cute". It's an every Friday ritual. After a long week I require myself a quality cocktail or a nice glass of wine to welcome the weekend. The place looks like a tiny "cute" little house on the sidewide. The ambiance inside is very simple, "cute", and clean with very artsy and interesting decor. Bar stools, tables, and couches, great place to sit and relax. However, I may warn you - there is a regular who is really annoying. Talks your brains out and talks to whoever he can grab their attention. JUST IGNORE HIM and you will be fine, he'll get the point.

HEIFER STATS.

DELLA FATTORIA BREAD PLATE ($4) - butter, crunchy veggies, and maldon salt. LOTS OF BREAD, a slab of delicious cheese with maldon salt on top, and salty veggies. This is a great filler when drinking wine. The cheese is SALTY, a thin spread over the bread will go a long way. The raw veggies, I'm not a fan... Raw radish? Your breath will be kickin. 

Deviled Eggs ($10) - smoked salmon and trout roe. it was lovely and "cute". This was probably one of the best deviled eggs I've had. the whipped yolk was smooth like silk and creamy, the smoked salmon gave it an additional layer of flavor, and the trout roe added the salty factor. It also came with a side of pickled vegetables and cucumber. Not sure that was a great combination with the eggs. And the presentation was beautiful... just not the teal round dinner plate it was served on (i know, i'm so judgemental LOL).

SANGUINETO SANGIOVESE/CANAIOLO MONTEPUCIANO 2011 ($14/glass) - where do i begin?! This WOW'd my face off. It was a very nice smooth red wine. I can go back for several glasses, heck... order a bottle!!!! I will say it is a creeper and it will hit moments after. I AM A FAN.

Will I be back? YUP.

JABA APPROVED. Until the next review...
author: Jane A.

description: 20 spot has the good vibes. Super cool vinyl playing in the background. We heard Kendrick Lamar's new album while sipping on some wine and eating the famous carrot box cake. My boyfriend and I were relaxed and after went to Bruno's to go dance. Great area and safe to walk at night. Will return for more wine and laughs.
author: Evelyn O.

description: Wow, pleasantly surprised! We just happened to stumble upon this place. Everything we ordered was delicious. We ordered the cheese plate, octopus gnocchi, Brussels sprouts, and pulled pork sliders. They even threw in comp olives. The restaurant is a quaint, unique, intimate with funky decor and great lighting. All of the staff was super friendly. I recommend it for a date night or a girls night.
author: Terese O.

description:
I really enjoyed the atmosphere here. It is a pretty tiny place, but they've made the best possible use of the space to offer as much seating as they can. The concept is great! You get to relax and drink wine. Plus the music was spot on. 

I'm not sure if the menu changes at all, but I ordered a red blend wine and the bread with porcini butter. The wine was excellent. And the bread. Wow, the bread had just the right amount of chew. And they offered an assortment of bread too. There were 4 slices on the plate, all very unique. The porcini butter was clearly housemade with a hint of lemon, really delightful and fresh. I would certainly make this my go-to spot if I lived here.
author: Mandy R.

description:
I had a splendid birthday dinner here w/ the bf. The service was awesome, & the vibe is lively but not too loud, relaxed but still nice (I'd feel comfortable dressing up or down). 

DECOR: Well-thought-out classy retro, interspersed w/ random colorful art (Die Antwoord concert posters in the bathroom, geometric brass Africana-looking statue in the hallway). I love the retro & antique mismatched dinner- & silver-ware:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/20-spot-san-francisco?select=lGbRZvmE6ZCs4pvwDHeTsA#uPB5I6Z5nlMf6uPcULvHsQ
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/20-spot-san-francisco?select=lGbRZvmE6ZCs4pvwDHeTsA#EyqZV-lnip2tKgtbUmshzQ

THE WAIT: My bf called at ~8pm on a Thursday to hold a table. It was waiting for us at 9pm, but there were a few tables open anyway. When we left around 10:45pm, there were plenty of people still eating & at the bar!

SERVICE: Excellent! We were greeted right away, they knew our name on the list, our server came to our table immediately & checked on us regularly. I felt terrible because I tried three different wines before settling on one she'd originally suggested. She was incredibly patient, professional, & nice.

MUST-HAVES: None, unfortunately! Almost everything was well prepared but at the same time could have been greatly improved w/ one small change. That being said, of what we tried, the Burrata, Duck Lasagne, & Panna Cotta were more memorable.

REDS: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/20-spot-san-francisco?select=lGbRZvmE6ZCs4pvwDHeTsA#VIGZbXmfftnpwg6HthzlUw

BILL OF FARE: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/20-spot-san-francisco?select=lGbRZvmE6ZCs4pvwDHeTsA#Dy47Mh22TXM6Bl04LoK2jg
* 1/2 dozen beausoleil oysters (shallot mignonette, 20 spot hot. $20) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/20-spot-san-francisco?select=lGbRZvmE6ZCs4pvwDHeTsA#oq_ThUsTHO4bMPqnoJUINw
hot sauce: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/20-spot-san-francisco?select=lGbRZvmE6ZCs4pvwDHeTsA#OQBv9q0k1_wzf9QYVmFPPw
Served on a wooden board on top of a bed of pebbles! Fresh, tasty, & we totally loved the hot sauce (made in house!).

* Burrata (asparagus, fennel, salsa verde. $14) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/20-spot-san-francisco?select=lGbRZvmE6ZCs4pvwDHeTsA#IABzRzAHrPlXzJs_9DMRZg
one serving: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/20-spot-san-francisco?select=lGbRZvmE6ZCs4pvwDHeTsA#Z-Nm81-k47_-2TFfseJCjw
Great! The burrata was soft & stretchy, subtly flavored, & the fresh greens & small slices of asparagus were a perfect complement. I wish there was an extra dash of sea salt to add a bit more flavor. We added some hot sauce from the oysters & that was good.

* Devilled eggs (smoked salmon, trout roe, cucumber. $10) - 3 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/20-spot-san-francisco?select=lGbRZvmE6ZCs4pvwDHeTsA#LeLtRmZPTqm-8Blp9Zt3-g
Well made, but not particularly a stand-out. The filling was very soft, & while the roe was a nice touch, it all just got blended in when you took a bite, probably because there was just an overwhelming amount of filling. Less filling & a topping w/ more texture/flavor (i.e. bacon!) would have made this much more interesting.

* Rabbit lasagne (chard, tomato, fromage blanc. $20) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/20-spot-san-francisco?select=lGbRZvmE6ZCs4pvwDHeTsA#lr6r9VcZ2GvBHOzweBwwCg
cross-section: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/20-spot-san-francisco?select=lGbRZvmE6ZCs4pvwDHeTsA#YKqSGQ3tHlpJLglZSYf2VQ
Really nice, but in retrospect this was pretty pricey for a dish for one. The tomato was zesty & fresh, the cheese balanced it well, & the lasagna sheets soft. It had a bit of a spicy kick. The spinach layer at the bottom was tough compared to the lasagna & harder to cut through when I wanted to get a bite w/ good proportions of everything. I think it would've been better if integrated into a layer of the lasagna.

DESSERT: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/20-spot-san-francisco?select=lGbRZvmE6ZCs4pvwDHeTsA#Ir7t_sxwp10CBCKTvHPcSA
* Buttermilk panna cotta (lemon curd, blueberries. $7) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/20-spot-san-francisco?select=lGbRZvmE6ZCs4pvwDHeTsA#eITDi_h8Es-iJEElsyA3tg
This was great, but don't make the mistake of digging only into the top! It's hard to tell, but only the top 1/4 is the lemon curd. My first few bites were purely lemon curd & I was overwhelmed by the sweetness. The panna cotta's (which had perfect soft texture) flavor was more neutral & blended really well w/ the lemon curd. The blueberries weren't ripe enough - they definitely could have been softer & sweeter.

SWEET & FORTIFIED WINE
* Nieport 10 year Tawny Port ($12) - 3 stars
Once again, that grain alcohol fortification - you can definitely taste it, & it doesn't blend well w/ the wine, a lighter port.

* Landgraf Riesling Auslese, 2009 ($10) - 4.5 stars
Came chilled, lightly sweetened, yet w/ a little bit of a tart fruit flavor. Well balanced, just strong enough, & light. I enjoyed this throughout my meal.

To try next time: Hamachi, Mussels (smelled great!).
author: Ziyan C.

description:
4.5 STARS

The First Date.

Many people have asked me for suggestions on where they should bring a first date. You want to impress the girl (or guy) without looking like Mr. Desperado who hasn't gotten laid in a century by forgoing your rent with foo-foo tasting menus. But, you don't want to be that guy who gives off the cheapass vibe by suggesting to grab a banh mi in the TL and share a pee-stained curb and a 40 with the hobo you're sitting next to. The latter actually happened to me. *Sigh* Damn you, Match.com. 

You want a place in the middle of the cost spectrum and that's intimate yet low-key. A place that you can hold a conversation without feeling like have to shout so nearly deaf, Mrs. Simpson (Saved by the Bell) can hear you. 

Equally important is a place with good food and drinks. Nothing quite gets a date going as booze right? Remember to always follow Patti Stanger's rule of a two drink max or you may end up like Mr. NSS and I; we have no recollection of our first date other than the hangover we both had the next day. No bueno. 

Walking into 20 Spot, I immediately knew this would be THE perfect first date spot. Formerly a record store, 20 Spot has been transformed to small restaurant and wine bar with a contemporary vintage rock ambiance. There's just four 2-top tables, a communal table, and counter seats so do come early to snag a seat as it's a walk-in restaurant: http://bit.ly/1as0tzQ. You can also chill on one of their leather sofas and they even have a vintage rocking chair. Candles and soothing soul music really set the mood if you know what I mean. *Wink wink*

Their New American menu is small and changes daily. There's less than 10 items on the menu excluding their cheese offerings and dessert. We sampled about half the menu and I have to say, I was very impressed (there were some slight misses though) because they don't have a real kitchen other than several appliances like an immersion circulator, a toaster oven and an induction burner.

We started off with the Oysters ($3 each) which are a must order: http://bit.ly/1cYy5tr. They were like taking a bite of the fresh ocean breeze. Next, came the Hamachi ($15) served sashimi style: http://bit.ly/174WKYC. Although fresh, I felt some the combo of the leeks, preserved lemon, grapes, espelette overpowered the delicacy of the fish. But this is coming from someone who likes to eat her nigiri with just a dab of wasabi and soy.  

If you like smoked salmon, you must order their Deviled Eggs ($10) if it's available on the menu: http://bit.ly/1ioEzSn. It was deliciously creamy with a nice pop of saltiness from the cured salmon and roe. And because it's crab season, we couldn't miss the Spiced Potted Dungeness Crab ($18) served with warm toast points: http://bit.ly/1cYo4MQ. It was chockfull of freshly sweet crab meat with just a hint of creaminess from the crème fraiche and zip from the meyer lemon. 

Nothing sticks to your ribs like a hunk of braised meat and that's what we thought the Farro & Short Ribs ($18) would be but it was more like a porridge: http://bit.ly/1aVGNHk. It was still delicious especially with the decadent soft boiled egg with an oozing yolk and generous shaving of  pecorino but I wish there was more short ribs. 

We ended dinner with the surprisingly and insanely divine Vanilla Panna Cotta ($7): http://bit.ly/1cYp97u. It was a tad stiff but once it hits your tongue, the silkiness was sublime. I adored all the vanilla bean flavor and soon found myself with an empty  jar. *Sad pouty lip*

In honor of hump day, I had two glasses of wine which the ladies at 20 Spot recommended; both were great. One offered me a tasting of Spanish wine to go with the faro and short ribs fish which was spectacular. I'm a total wine noob so I won't get into the nitty gritty details other than it gave me a good buzz. Two thumbs up from me. 

20 Spot may be in hipsterville but there's not a bit of 'tude here. Service was wonderful. The ladies who waited on us were warm, attentive, and knew their sh*t. If I could take them to every restaurant I eat at, I would.  

As for parking, if the parking gods aren't kind to you, there's a garage 2 blocks away on 21st and Bartlett. 

Mr. NSS and I are well past our first date but 20 Spot made me feel like we were on a first date again...minus the WtfHappenedLastNight hangover.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
This is such a cute place for a date. The music was a little loud and the restaurant is a little dark, but both contribute to the classy mood, I suppose. It's a new-ish place. I came here with my friend and we were initially skeptical of the food because it didn't sound all that appetizing. We decided to take a risk and order a few things.

Holy crap. The Deviled Eggs ($10) are to die for. They have trout, roe, and cornichon... words cannot explain how godly these eggs are. Seriously. Hands down my favorite dish of the whole meal. I would go out of my way for these 20 Spot Deviled Eggs anyday. We also ordered the Spanish Octopus ($17) with fingerling potato, castelvetrano olives, and harissa. It was my friend's favorite dish. The quantity of octopus is super generous and the texture is very tender. 

Before I progress further with food, I want to say that the House Wine Flight ($20) was the second best idea next to the deviled eggs. It comes with three different selections, and they matched well with the variety of foods that we ordered. 

In our second round of food, we got the Rainbow Carrots ($13) which was pretty good, and that's coming from a person who does not like carrots. The Lentil Soup ($9) was recommended by our waitress. THAT is the best lentil soup I've ever had. The menu is very counterintuitive because I liked dished that I normally wouldn't order because they did not sound appealing. 

Anyways, our meal ended with the must-have Panna Cotta ($8) which was topped with chunks of rhubarb. Light and refreshing. Would recommend. Overall, thank you to our waitress Karina for showing us a fantastic culinary experience! Fantastic recommendations. And remember... get the DEVILED EGGS.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Great spot. Solid list. Solid food. But my favorite part is its character and you know the place was built with love and not money. Kinda like the old SF spots that would open and the few that remain. Not to let this get into a "SF is changin" convo, because that would be unfair to 20 Spot. 

def. check it out. Authentic, high quality, memorable.
author: Mohammad G.

description: Love love 20 Spot. It's a very low key mid-century modern space in the mission that's fit for a first date or a 100th. Intimate and dimly lit with vintage vinyl selections by the owner, it makes for great sipping and conversation (and maybe even a little G-rated canoodling). 20 Spot is a don't miss if you live in SF or are visiting and want a glass or 2 of wine in a great space.
author: Sandy G.

description:
First of all, I completely echo the sentiments of Yelper's reviews:
PLUS: Cute spot that used to be a record shop
PLUS: Ridiculously nice servers
PLUS: Awesome music - so awesome I had to request the name/artist of a song from the server because I couldn't get my Shazam pulled up fast enough
PLUS: WAY generous pours
PLUS: Awesome selection of wine

AND NOW the big BUUUUUUUTTTT...
After reading these yelp reviews about pate and pot of crab and oysters (omnomnom salivation) the menu had none of these items!! Heads up...the menu is one of those that is constantly changing. Do not get your hopes up until you see it in person!!

With that said, we ended up with a light dinner of bread, deviled eggs and an octopus that was off-menu. Everything was of course, delicious, but it just wasn't what we were expecting. BUT (another but!) now that you've read my review you know what to expect and that is not to expect what you expected.

Don't let this last bit deter you from 20 spot - scroll up and review all my previous PLUSES! It really is a great low-key spot to enjoy a Friday night and I am glad we stopped in =) Will be back some more menu surprises!
author: Christina L.

description:
Love love love this place!  My wife and I had a date night out and had read so much about 20 Spot that we had to try it out.  We sat at the bar and the server was so attentive and gave us great recommendations.  We had the olive and nuts, deviled eggs, crab pot (soo good), salad and the cheese platter.  The cheese platter was awesome and highly recommended.  Heck, everything we had I would recommend.

I also got the flight of wine and they were very full pours :) 

Great intimate date spot in SF.
author: Blake B.

description:
Deviled eggs were good.  A little pricey for being just 2 eggs, but it's SF.

Crispy duck was delicious.  I wish I had ordered this instead of the cod.  My friend cleaned her plate.

Cod was flavorless and bland.  It came with quinoa and this salsa verde sauce, which you couldn't taste at all.  I ended up dumping half a bottle of hot sauce.  It was edible, but not something I would have paid $20 for.  I would not buy again. 

Atmosphere was cool lounge. Music very loud, so it's difficult to hear if you're sitting at a table across from someone.  

Overall, 4 stars for great customer service and good crispy duck.
author: Sasha R.

description: If you are interested in amazing food and wine this is your place. Yes, the wait can be long at times but we'll worth it.
author: Millie P.

description:
Awesome food! Crudo, buratta, potatoes, etc. all good! The ribs were a miss and hence the 4 star.

It's new American tapas style, good for a group of friends to try multiple items.

Definitely try both desserts!
author: Raj S.

description:
Such a cute spot tucked away in the Mission! The setting is very posh, perfect for a date or a girls night. I'd also say its reasonably priced for the food, but bottles of wine will start from the $50 price point. I went with a girlfriend and our bill came out to over $60 a person - but what's cheap in SF? 

On the food, everything I tried was very delicious and fresh! I had the deviled eggs, ceviche toast (so lemony!!), octopus (the potatoes had tons of flavor) and the corn and snap pea dishes. I will say I was disappointed that they didn't have the crap pot that is all over its Yelp page, but overall, I was very satisfied and want to come back to try more! Great wait staff too!
author: Samantha C.

description: Had a couple of wonderful wines and delicious food. Owner Bodhi Freedom and the rest of his staff was incredibly helpful and hospitable. He picked a Cabernet for me that was to die for. Highly recommend this place. The music really adds to the atmosphere.
author: Todd T.

description: They do everything really great. Literally any food you order will be tasty. Even the bread is well done and a delight.
author: Kade S.

description: One of my favorite places in the Mission for date night or to meet up with friends.  It has the best ambiance - lively but cozy, great decor and they always play awesome music.  The food is delicious and perfect to share.  They focus mostly on European wines which I prefer. You may not like the selection as much if you drink mostly California wines, but the servers are great and I'm sure would help you find something you like.
author: Kristina H.

description: I stopped in at 20 spot for a drink with a couple friends. The setup inside is nice and cozy with several different couch areas to sit at. The service left a lot to be desired, but it was overall a great place to have a drink.
author: Joelle K.

description: Highly recommend this place! Great wine and food with a very cool vibe and excellent service!
author: Sarah S.

description:
Excellent food. But feels like the place is confused .. Wine bar or restaurant?

Grab a glass early and sit in the rocking chairs in the front ... Nice!
author: David B.

description: This Mission gem is a wine lover's dream. Great wines, super fun mid century meats modern hip decor and an interesting and well executed food. The menu isn't expansive but everything they do they do well. The ambient e can't be beat. Perfect date spot or chilling with friends.
author: Chad R.

description:
Fine for drinks but had a very negative experience for dinner. Our table was given away because of poor staff communication, and our thirty minute wait turned into an hour and thirty minutes. Unfortunately, this isn't the first time it's happened either.

I suggest having a backup if you come here for dinner, or just avoid all together. I'd recommend Dosa for vegetarians, or Hog & Rock for those who aren't. Again, great wine.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Love, love, love this spot (no pun intended)! 

The staff is so great and makes sure you're always taken care of, even when they're busy (which is most nights). It's also a great place to grab a drink by yourself (as is sometimes necessary). The ambiance allows for a feeling of community and socializing with neighbors and/or the servers. 

The wine selection is always great, they have a good range for all flavor profiles, from lift to fruity to earthy. And the staff will always help you with a great rec if you need one. 

The food is v tasty too. I love the deviled eggs! They used to have a really really great chicken liver mousse with champagne jam, but I think the they took it off. Hope they bring it back (hint! hint!). I've also had their cauliflower soup - so rich and creamy! The menu is seasonal which I appreciate.
author: Rita K.

description: Very nice environment/decor/wine, but bartenders weren't very friendly, had to wave them down to get water or more wine, waited quite a while for the check, and they seemed happier helping everyone else (regulars?). Hope it's friendlier to all next time we try.
author: Ms X.

description:
Amazing wine- awesome atmosphere. Want to come back for dinner.

My friend and I had wine- place was packed but we found two seats up front. I can't get over how awesome this place is. Old record store. #cute
author: Amanda M.

description: Stop what you're doing and get yourself over to this restaurant right now.  And do it quick because they don't take reservations.  This place is a gem hidden within The Mission.  The food, the staff, the vibe, and the overall experience was a 10/10.  Every dish wash was inventive and delicious.  I cannot recommend this place enough.
author: James C.

description:
Really Good.
The atmosphere was cool and laid back. It felt more like a wine bar with dim lighting, cool crowd and small but nice set up.

They have wine and beer and pretty good selections too.

For food, the portions are tapas style so the good thing is you can order a bit of everything. 
We started with olives and nuts and the accoutrements that came with it. Delicious. 
The bread platter was very well received by my husband and friend as well, i am not crazy about bread but i did taste some and it was very, very good. The butter was super fresh too!.
We also ordered the burrata and it was very good, soft and creamy. Yummy.

We also had a special sea bass that they had that night and it was absolutely delicious, not overcooked and i wish i remembered what was the sauce that the seabass was in because it was fantastic. We were very happy with this place that i wish we would have had more time to go back again before we left town.
Great addition to the Mission district. Our server was also great.

The ambiance was and decor was really cool as well. Laid back music and nice , younger crowd.

Nice place to have a few drinks in the evening and get a bite.
author: Carolina M.

description: So in love with this cozy, welcoming space. We stopped in for a glass of wine & fell in love with the decor and helpful staff.
author: Jaime L.

description:
Stopped by to grab a drink with my cousin at this new neighborhood depot.

Tapas style restaurant with about 10 or so seasonal dishes, wine by the glass/bottle, draft and bottled beer.

Dimly lit ambiance, thought I saw a couple of first dates going on.  Relaxed, casual bookstore kind of feel.

Had the: Deviled Eggs and Black Cod.  Black cod was well prepared and super tender.  Deviled eggs were great, but could have used some more paprika.

Will come by again to check out the alcohol selection.
author: Alan H.

description:
Drink 5 
 I like their selection of wine.
Food 4
 Olives infused orange was amazing! the best olives I ever had. 
Ambiance 4 bit too dark?
Service 5
Price 5
author: Tory T.

description:
I have no idea how this spot got the positive reviews. The Food is below average and the service is bad! Seems like they not familiar with the wine selection and they can't provide a descriptions. They didn't suggest any water which is pretty basic thing to do. 
I am definitely not coming back to this place!!!
author: Yana A.

description:
Totally fell in love with this little gem!! 

Food 5 x 
Selection of wines 5 x 
Atmosphere  5 x 
Service 5 x 

Try their Spanish octopus and buttermilk panna cotta! Heavenly!
author: Nao N.

description:
Cute little wine bar with a somewhat mod/mid century vibe. Came here with some friends on a random weekday night around the time of its opening in fall 2013. 

I was one of the first people in the place at around 5:30 pm for dinner service, and I remember seeing a woman at the bar with an empty glass of wine reading a book looking just so comfortable and at home and I thought "wow this place must be something special." Mgmt was very welcoming and friendly and chatted me up before my friends arrived.

Place would make a good date spot--would def come back again.
author: Sam R.

description:
Pros:
 - Nice waitress. very helpful.
 - Great music, ambience, and lighting.
- A bit on the smaller side, but not too packed and we were able to find a place to sit.

Cons:
- Nothing in particular.

Overall:
- Would definitely go back, especially on a date (e.g. after grabbing dinner in the mission).
author: Sid D.

description:
It was ok. I was not impressed by the pricing nor the food/wine. I do like the location and the inside is very cute, but overall, I would not recommend this place to a friend nor would I go again myself. It's just overhyped (am I old?)

I ordered the potato soup and it was very good but not filling. My friends and I went to grab tacos afterwards (and it wasn't a cheap dinner) because the food didn't fill any of us up.
author: Carina M.

description: It's all around a great spot for wine, bites and a great night! It's unpretentious especially with Bodi at the helm.  Pear salad with peanut sauce and blue cheese...wow!
author: Stacy T.

description:
Funky name and great new gem.

I secretly loves restaurant that doesn't take reservation, sometimes you just wanted to make last min plans and drop into a delicious local spot.

Stopping by before 6 was a great decision, we got seated promptly at the sofa area, and we got a mix of few things, a bit of Asian fusion. 

The fresh Hamachi was really good, and so as the grill octopus. 

They have about 6 beer on top, but also about 6 wine plus on tap, they also have flight of the day, we tried some pinot, pretty good.

Overall is a layback spot, and service is overall good, staffs got pretty busy at some point, but they make sure you know they got ya.
author: Alice C.

description: Really fun atmosphere for girls' night! We enjoyed a flight of wine and appetizer on our way to dinner. Will definitely make plans to eat here next time!
author: Paula W.

description: Ok the records sign out front was the best part.  Unfriendly inattentive service, mediocre wine and cheesy music. I love a record player as much as the next person but it only works if you're playing good shit.
author: Christen M.

description:
Casual and elegant neighborhood place. I arrived early and the staff was welcoming, with no pressure to order before my friend arrived. The bread and cheese plate and the cheese options were well curated (4 distinct cheeses are available, from regional cheese makers). The octopus was excellent - warm and flavorful, not overcooked or rubbery. The wine list was not long but has a good range as well - local, German, Greek, French, Italian. Seating options include a couple of lounge-like tables with sofas, as well as a bar area and more traditional tables and chairs. Staff are friendly and knowledgeable, able to guide my friend to a wine she liked based on her preferences. They were also happy to chat with two well-behaved and curious young children (approx. 6 and 8) while their parents ate dinner.    

I look forward to returning and trying more from the menu.
author: A N.

description:
Great ambiance and wine selection. Pretty small and intimate space. Came here with a large party and there were not many tables besides us. Menu is good but not extensive. Really good cheese plates (fruit, nuts, vegetables), mussels, deviled eggs, bread and butter. Don't go if you are really hungry- more of a nibbling place. 

Service was perfect! Very accommodating to a large group.
author: Semuteh F.

description: The food and service were great. Even on a Tuesday night, this place was very crowded, but we were able to get a spot at the bar for dinner after waiting for just a few minutes. The deviled eggs, the caprese salad, and the spanish octopus were all excellent. The wine was great. The service was impeccable. It is not cheap, but prices seem appropriate for the level of quality and the swanky atmosphere. Highly recommended!
author: Toby S.

description:
Not sure if it's always this hot here, but it was about 75 degrees inside last Thursday night. Our entire party was sweating and gulping down carafes of complimentary water.


Aside from the sauna-like temperatures, the interior is very cute and cozy. The dim, candlelit room creates a feel of intimacy and anonymity all at once. 

Friendly service. Expect to pay. The most affordable glass of wine starts at 12$. But hey, there's always beer.

-1 for the heat
-1 for being too expensive for a poor student to attend on the regular
+1 for having lots of seating when we arrived (granted it wasnt the wknd)
+1 for interior design
+1 nice service
author: Nina M.

description: Cozy wine bar, relaxed & great selection. Haven't tried the cheese plate yet but that's next!
author: KS K.

description:
Great little place for wine bar without too many craziness. A good addition to the Mission for a laid-back place to hang. The riesling was the best of the white wine by the glass (Eva Fricke Riesling, Trocken, Rheingau, 2012). I also liked the Burgundy Red (Berthoux  Pinot Noir, Givry 1er cru, Burgundy, 2011)

For food, I liked the spiced potted dungeness crab with crème fraiche, toast, meyer lemon. Chunky fresh crab with not-too-heavy creme fraiche, making it the perfect spread for the toast. I like sitting at the bar the best. The seats in the front are a bit isolated and lacks energy in the air.
author: Rebecca C.

description: Love this place! Really knowledgable staff, always interesting tasty wines and generous pours. The food is pretty good, I like the cheese plate and whatever vegetable they have. It's a bit small so not good for large groups but good for a date night.
author: Lauren M.

description:
GREAT date spot.

Finally, a destination in The Mission worth it's weight in wine. Leave it up to proprietor-bottle jockey Bodhi Freedom (who also owns the ten seat hideaway Bacchus on Russian Hill) to suggest an outstanding wine you've probably never heard of with an equally tasty nosh from their creative menu.

It's easy to strike up a chat with the random cool customer, surrounded by a distinctly stylish retro couture in a part of town-that really needed it.
author: A N.

description: Went here with a friend and got a couple of glasses of red wine, the halibut ceviche and the burratta. Would highly reccomend all the dishes I tried. I wouldnt come here if you are starving though!
author: Lauren S.

description:
Rock on.

Formerly a record store: http://www.grubstreet.com/2013/03/20-spot-20th-street-mission-menu-opening.html

Now spinning old LPs and some of the Mission's finest small plates.

There is a first time for everything and tonight it was oysters. Needed instructions a non-judgemental eye. Basically needed the person with me. 

Topped with bits of apple and a taste that was surprisingly appealing by the time we finished our dozen all that was needed was one more.

Miscommunication with our server meant deviled eggs instead of the bread plate. Fortunately these roe topped wonders were a delicious surprise.

Bread was not lacking as plenty was served with the chicken liver mousse (rich and very good) and crab pot (so much butter it unfortunately overshadowed the crab).

Highlight might have been the tuna accented with some sort of seed or grain. Can't remember the last time raw fish tasted so good.

Wine is a specialty just like their impeccable 60s, 70s and 80s soundtrack. My dining companion's opinion mattered more than mine. She enjoyed her glass of Carignan.

Space is small and intimate but relaxed which is perfect for first dates, hundredth dates or is this a date. No wait for a table at 8:30 on Saturday which was a nice surprise.

Roughly $60/person which felt reasonable and very much worthwhile. Only thing holding back a fifth star was the service.

Table next to us was more engaging than our server, aforementioned order snafu and the long wait for our bill left us with no time for dessert. Never like missing dessert.

But 20 still gets a strong four. Expect them to rock on for a long time to come.
author: Jason B.

description: I love the intimate vibe of this place.  Located on a corner- you would miss it if you didn't know it was there.  Disguised as an old record store, 20 Spot is a dim lit wine bar with mis matched furniture- making it super homey and comfortable.  Great wine list, cool crowd, tasty bites.  A must try if you haven't been there.
author: Melissa P.

description: I don't like to leave bad reviews but this place was awful!  We got one drink at the bar and then the bartenders ignored us for the rest of the time we were there...we sat there with empty glasses for like 45 minutes until we decided leave. And the funniest part of the entire experience was that while we were sitting there (at a very small bar with empty glasses) the 3 bartenders were pouring each other wine and drinking!  Anyway, I won't be going back...it was just poor bar service on a very slow night.
author: Amanda G.

description:
Only reason it wasn't love at first sight is because we walked right past 20 Spot....backtracked a few paces and realized we'd arrived. It really is an unassuming place, so keep your eyes peeled!

Lovely little wine bar - it's a tiny shoebox type space, but boasts a beautiful bar area and a handful of two tops lining the wall. Dim lights, awesome 90s classic rock music, and a solid wine and snack list, what is not to love? There was a fabulous duo of ladies working the bar area - friendly, attentive, and clearly knew their way with wine. 

Was a perfect spot for a V Day night cap!
author: Brianna M.

description:
My roommates & I came here for a few Monday Fundays, and we were hooked!  The bartenders, servers, & owner are knowledgable and friendly.  The food is amazing and the service is top notch.  The wine list has never disappointed me either. 

I'm hesitant to write a raving review because I selfishly want this place to be a hidden gem, but I think the word has gotten out.  

This is definitely my neighborhood go-to spot.  Love that it's intimate, stylishly casual, and laid back.  I will keep coming back!
author: Aya S.

description: Great spot in the mission to get a glass of wine and listen to good music! Perfect for intimate conversations. The staff is prompt but don't bother you too much! Highly tecommend!
author: Alex D.

description: I really love the atmosphere, warm and cozy. Came to grab drinks before dinner. Had some wine and snacks. The olives so good, it's unusual to be surprised about magnificent olives.  Also had the deviled eggs which were tasty as well. The staff was really friendly.
author: Nicole M.

description:
The vibes of a laid back coffee shop, universally liked music from a record player, and the menu of a wine bar. I'm in.

Great place to hang out with a few friends and enjoy some drinks and conversation. Maybe it's the music, maybe it's the physical appearance, but there's something jazzy and relaxing about this place that I really enjoy. I get a lot of the benefits of those speakeasy (cozy, feeling like you're going back in time) type bars without the pretension. Also, the couch is comfortable - if you can snatch it you'll sink right in and never want to leave. 

The flight is a really good deal, by the way! Super generous pours, although it would be nice to get some choice in what wines you got. 

Great service.
author: Sara M.

description:
10 Reasons why 20 spot is the perfect place to spend your evening:

1) It's located just off of Valencia St. so as to be in the Mission, without being in the thick of things or overly crowded.
2) It's also not too far for you to feel uncomfortable walking. The Mission can feel that way, at times.
3) Great wine selection: my personal favorite is the teutonic from Santa Barbara. The perfect summer drink. Once in a while, they let you taste before settling, but you need not worry if they don't. Every bottle selected for the menu is wonderful. 
4) Pours are generous. If you've been served the bottom of the bottle, they're sure to give a little more.
5) Wait staff is attentive and charming.
6) Food is delicious--from the bread plate to the deviled eggs. Please don't come here expecting to get a full dinner experience--this is definitely a wine bar, and the food selections are small portions. (Amazingly delicious small portions.)
7) The atmosphere is smart and intimate. This is the biggest selling point, for me. I find myself spending an entire evening here, rather than what I'd planned to only be the beginning of my night.
8) They play their music from a record player. It's a mix of classic rock and indie hits. Off the top of my head, I remember hearing The Cure and The Black Keys in the same night. It's at just the perfect volume to facilitate conversation.
9) Variety of seating: you can pick a table, a seat by the bar, or even one of two corner sofas. All cozy. 
10) One of the bartenders has begun to remember me. Becoming a regular is the ultimate perk.

I'm away from San Francisco, at the moment, and I can't help but miss this place terribly. I daydream about the riesling, lightly toasted whole grain bread, and orange infused olives. I think I have a problem.
author: Nicole C.

description:
Service was great. 

Ambiance was definitely romantic. 

We ordered a bottle of wine, three (smallish) plates 1. Oysters 2. Shrimp Cups 3. Some sort of salad and had the choco pudding for dessert (which was the highlight of the meal) ..........and ended up paying 120$+ dollars!

Too pricey for me, which is why 20 spot gets only 3 stars.
author: Geralyn Y.

description:
20 Spot is a cozy little wine bar perfect for a date or a small group of friends.  A little get together over some wine and small bites after a long day of work is always a nice touch before bed.

First time I was here with some friends, and we all fell in love with this cozy place.  We ordered everything on their menu except the salad which they just threw in there for us since that was the only thing missing from the menu on our order.  A couple bottles of wine later, some laughter, and another round of bites we vowed to be back.  That we did.

Their menu changes quite frequently depending on what they can get their hands on.  There are a couple of things on the menu that were always available every time we've been there.  The oysters are always fresh and a great start to the night with a bottle of champagne or sweet riesling.

I'm a sucker for deviled eggs especially when the flavors and combination of ingredients are endless.  The little kid in me awakens every time I see a different devil to try.  Over here, they make theirs with smoked salmon, trout roe, and cucumber.  Little bites like these always tend to make the bottles go faster as the girls gossip and laugh.  

Mussels are steamed with tarragon butter and leeks.  First things first here.  Dip the bread into that tasty butter and indulge in its aroma as your palate salivates for more.  Then reach in for that fresh juicy mussel!  Hate it when a restaurant either overcooks the mussels or serve mussels with a smell.  That won't be happening here.

It's too bad they don't always have meats on their menu.  When we did get the chance, we were able to have a beautifully braised lamb shank.  Meat falling off the bones with flavors deeply infused.  It melted in our mouths.  Amazing.

I don't want to put up false 411 so someone please let me know if my hunch is correct.  I think they may have changed their chef.  The most recent time I was there, the food seemed a little off or different as a whole.  Not sure.  I hope they didn't change their chef because that would be a sad reason for me not to spend more time at this little gem in the city.

Service however can use just a little bit of charm.  The owners, a brother and sister maybe in their 40's, are such kind and friendly people!  Such warm hospitality from them all the time, but their servers don't seem to have that same energy totally misrepresenting the owners' love for their bar.  I've had 4 different servers here, and I always seem to feel rushed or on the other end of their mild irritations... for what I don't know.  What I hear from friends and from other reviews, it seems like others are experiencing the same thing.  It's not too bad but it sure needs a little help.

I agree with some other yelpers about the menu being on the pricey side.  It's not expensive but a bit up there for what they serve.  Not too bad if everyone in your group is splitting the tab.  If you don't mind spending a little more this place is a really great place to wind down.  I'd still come back for the most part unless someone can confirm for me that they changed their chef.  Quality of their dishes aren't spectacular the way I remember the very last time I went.

3.5 stars based on my last visit but overall because of the owners and the handful of times I've been there I have to round up to 4 stars for the fond memories.
author: Colin M.

description:
Dropped in on a Monday night to get a little wine and a light nosh at an affordable price. Turns out Monday was $20 off a bottle of wine, so we got a nice French red, a cheese plate, olives, and caviar for about 60 bucks. Bravo. 

The place is small with a neighborhood-y feel. Lots of mid-century furniture. Attentive service. Will definitely be back.
author: Steve S.

description: Stopped by for some wine to kill time while waiting for a table elsewhere. Warm, cozy atmosphere. It's definitely quiet enough to have a proper conversation with someone. Bartender was very sweet and helped us choose our wine!
author: Haru M.

description:
If you want a laid-back yet sleek experience in the world of wine 20 spot is the place to go. They have an extensive selection of by the glass wines and I have yet to come across a dud, after a dozen visits. I have a lot of respect for well-curated wine lists and 20 spot really nails it on this criteria alone. The service is professional and attentive and they give great recommendations and feature interesting flights of wines on a rotating basis. 

I haven't tried the food yet but it looks delicious! 

A great spot for a date, catching up with friends, or for a an after dinner drink when you don't quite wan the night to end yet. 

Check it out!
author: Reilly B.

description: Was here 7-2-16, what a lovely place to be at.  Small restaurant but very crowded.  My husband and I enjoyed it very much.  Waitress seemed a little impatient with us, but we will still return again some day.
author: Christina S.

description: 20 Spot is a cute little wine bar, but with a very limited menu of food that changes.  We tried the green toast (which has toast, cheese, strawberries, and mustard greens), cauliflower, and oysters.  The cauliflower and oysters were pretty good, as was the wine.  The green toast was okay, but I would've preferred something else if there'd been anything on the menu that sounded better (nothing on the menu sounded that great the night we went).  The place also had a weird scent that smelled a little like vomit.  I think it might've been caused by the cauliflower dish they offered that night (I noticed that a number of tables ordered it), but I'm not 100% sure.
author: Cici A.

description: Too bad this spot is discovered and now popular. It was a lovely little secret for a while ;) I love the wine menu and the simple, casual atmosphere.  Food is pretty good too. One of my favorite local wine bars in the mission that is still fairly unpretentious.
author: Hema P.

description:
So I really wanted to like this place, however, I don't think I'll be back. The bread was good, but not amazing. The hamachi was good, but it vanished from our table (i'll get to that shortly). The wines were tasty, but pricey comparatively. 

Outside of the actual food and beverage, the place is cute and trendy. It was however, the service that killed it for me. It started out fine, if not a bit rushed...no, I do not know which wine I want as you put the wine list on the table....Our night progressed, and each time we were not even halfway through a glass, we were asked to order another. On our third glass, our waitress tried to take the hamachi away, saying it had been sitting out too long...ummm, really? This is a wine bar, somewhere people come to chat, nibble and drink. There was no line, thus, no reason to rush us. We spent over $150, so, again, no reason to push us out.

I will not be back, there are far too many places in SF to enjoy
author: Bianca L.

description:
Excellent spot for a date or din with a few friends. Lounge-y feel, dim lighting, and records all work well. The food is excellent and the menu changes constantly, but right now, the potted crab (called a crab pot by one reviewer, which I kinda think is a better name) was divine and made me miss maryland blue crab. Oysters were tasty and the apple mignionette was really creative and quite tasty. Makes sense tho.

The poke and endive salad were both nicely done. We were a bit shocked to be so full after 4 small plates, but they got the job done.

My date chose the sparkling rose and that too was delish. 

They're doing good work over there and we'll be back.
author: Rob G.

description: Dropped by here after a disappointing meal elsewhere. Snagged a spot by the door for the desserts. Cool vibe, nice people and absolutely amazing desserts. Will come back and try the meal next time.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Wonderful vibe here with delicious wines to choose from. It feels like a small spot that belongs in the Village in New York City. I huddled with friends at the bar for about 2 hours, nursing our wines because they were so good, and yet our tolerance was not equally there. Nice waitstaff as well, very courteous. Looking forward to returning for a meal as everything coming out of the kitchen looked delicious.
author: Erin W.

description: Felt like a friend's festive and stylish house party. The service was attentive and warm without being overly pushy, and the food divine. You can't go wrong with the short ribs nor the burrata. And be sure to ask for their wine pairing suggestion -- a great way to learn and enjoy. We're eager to come back and can't wait to become regulars!!
author: Crystal K.

description:
A wonderful little spot to share food, wine and stories with friends.

The staff are attentive and friendly.

Fun fact for all your cinephiles:

Woody Allen's Blue Jasmine filmed upstairs.
author: Colleen C.

description:
Stopped in for a drink before dinner and found a winner!

This well appointed corner wine bar had tasty snacks. The owner is very welcoming and we felt like regulars despite being tourists. 

Don't miss this gem.
author: Frankie B.

description:
I can't say enough good things about this place. Small and unassuming, if you didn't know better you'd think this was a simple wine bar. 

Au contraire! 

 The moment I walked in I was greeted warmly and seated at the bar to begin my culinary journey. The bartender was exceptionally knowledgable about the wine list and willing to help me choose the perfect wine. 
I started with the hamachi and cucumber plate. Excellent and well prepared! It danced on the palate and was a very refreshing start to the meal. Next up was the Burrata and red beet salad.
