The frisée was fresh and edible, paired with a huge slice of burrata and garnished with delicious beets made it perfection. The dressing was minimal, which was important because the dish did not need to be overpowered. I finished with the potato and leek soup; I could have licked the bowl! 
 Each dish was paired with a perfect wine that was all at the suggestion of one of the owners of this fine establishment. 
 Amazing space, delicious food and exciting conversation all made this a special night. 

Don't miss out!
author: Eden F.

description: Happy hour at 20 Spot is charming, to say the least.  A delightful little place in the Mission that serves pretty outstanding and shareable items for a large group too!  Sitting just off Valencia, it's pretty easy to miss this little gem - I almost walked right by it thinking it was a furniture store! In any case, there were about 10 of us that showed up to 20 Spot in need of some Friday food and libations and we certainly got it.  Despite trying to say no, I caved and ate a significant portion of the Della Fattoria bread plate by myself.  Three different types of bread showed up, and when slathered with some maldon salt butter, this was hard to say no to.  Other items that showed up on the table were the olives & nuts, deviled eggs, and some grilled octopus. I couldn't stay for very long, but this would be a wonderful place to have a quiet/intimate happy hour with some close friends over some delicious looking wines and bubbly.  Definitely a gem in the Mission worth going back to!
author: Lisa I.

description: My boyfriend and I stopped in here on Thursday for a glass of wine before dinner. Love the cozy and welcoming ambiance! The bar manager/owner Brody? was super friendly in helping us find a wine we liked and turning us on to the vinyl they were playing. As we were leaving, it was pouring rain and hail. Brody? gave us an umbrella from the back to get to dinner. Thank you for your fenerosity! We're definitely excited to come back for more!
author: Payton F.

description: This is a great spot for a glass of wine!  We stopped by around 9:30pm on a Saturday night, were greeted by a warm, inviting atmosphere that was not too crowded.  The bartender was awesome, and let us taste a few different wines before we made our selections.  Our wines were great, and we loved the record collection and music.  We'll be back!
author: Barnali D.

description: Trendy but warm setting, not a huge wine selection, food decent but small / sharing portions only. Likely a better place on a week night
author: G T.

description: This place is THE BEST.  Please order the Rose and the cheese platter and enjoy some incredible tunes on vinyl.  The hosts were incredibly kind and generous for a group of new mamas who were out letting their hair down.  Thank you Bodhi and the rest of the ownership for making our night!
author: A S.

description:
This place is a leader in wine selection in San Francisco based on variety, quality and value.  The wine selection is paired so well, all you have to do is ask.  The staff is friendly and attentive.

I have been coming here with my boyfriend who  is a huge foodie and he only takes me to the best places.

We usually sit at the bar where we receive exceptional service by one of the owners Bodhi.  This place gets soooo... busy that we understand when he has to step away to help other guests. 

Their chef is Amazing!!! His style of cooking has gotten better since the last time we ate here.  The potatoes with cheese are by far my favorite and I get goosebumps just thinking about them! I also love their fresh salads and fresh cheeses. My boyfriend loves their fresh seafood.

Here are some facts you must know if you are planning to visit...

-they make their own butter
-they go out and buy fresh organic local produce every day
-the chef is so talented for having such a small, limited kitchen to work in
-the decor is so cool and I like that they kept the "records" sign outside
-beer selection is good too!!!

If you're looking for a non-pretentious place that has a spectacular wine and beer selection, paired with amazing food, you have to visit 20 Spot - you will not be disappointed.
author: Gabriela Y.

description: Great ambience and food. Had the halibut which was fabulous although it was a tiny dish. The couch is the best spot.
author: Eindra K.

description: I am glad that I checked this place out. My Chef suggest I should go. The place is a cute/romantic place. Great wine list and they play cool music. The staff is lovely and the food was on point! Will for sure go back.
author: Der Maibaum L.

description:
My new go-to wine bar in the mission.  Excellent wine menu and beer selection.  

Love the ambiance and cute, cozy spot for a date or catch up with friends.  

I'm a fan!
author: Jackie D.

description:
The good: lively place young crowd. Excellent mushrooms and mussels. Good wine and beer selection

The bad: small portions. Little for vegetarians. Super loud. Old folks look elsewhere.
author: Paul D.

description:
I had a great night at 20 spot. It's not cheap but I thought the food was excellent and the service was better. The atmosphere is intimate but upbeat.

The staff were super friendly and knowlegeable and let us try all the wines we got before we actually ordered it. They ran out of the desert we wanted, and gave us a desert wine for free and after I paid, I got an espresso and they did not charge me. 

I'll definitely be coming back again.
author: Aadil M.

description:
We went the other night and had a pathetic time. Its sorta a scam. We were deep in the mission with low ceilings, no air circulation, and a view of the brightly lit bathroom area...
The service is very casual, taco shop casual, and although there is some creative food stuff going on, the prices for wines by the glass is more Fillmore Street than the mission. I was reminded of central kitchen but then that place spent a mint on their kitchen and is a BEAUTIFUL space. When the bill came, all four of us we shocked, disappointed and sorta pissed.
author: Kate S.

description: Cute place, food menu isn't that extensive but a few appetizers and wine and you're set! It's a great, cozy hangout spot-comfy lounge chairs and a bar. I stopped here with my boyfriend randomly for some oysters and wine and they were delicious and the service was great!
author: Marina D.

description: Great selection of beer and wine. Small dishes to share with friends that taste fresh. Noise inside and crowed
author: Denise S.

description: This place is small and lacks the hype of some others, but it's fantastic.  Had the privilege of eating here right at opening time, and therefore got personal service from the owner who described to me how he bought the space and completely renovated it (decor is awesome).  He recommended some dishes all of which were incredible.  I also had to eat quickly given a flight I had to make, and they got me in and out of there in time.  Overall excellent experience and looking forward to go back.  Far superior to my meal at the much more hyped restaurant "the house" a couple weeks later.
author: Marc P.

description: First time stumbled upon this place last weekend and absolutely love it. The owner himself was incredibly nice and the service was great. Thinking we were just walking into a wine bar, we were beyond pleased with the food. Favorites to note were the duck dish + octopus. Love love love, and can't wait to go back!
author: Ava A.

description:
After a less then thrilling dinner somewhere else we stopped by 20 Spot for dessert and a glass. My mood was lifted and my frown turned upside down. Super yummy chocolate pudding with maybe a tad too sweet marshmallow top and a nice glass of port can take your bad mood away. 

It's a cool spot and it's super close to home. Had a good chat with the owner and left in a wayyyyy better place then I arrived in. Great vibe and cool cat decor.

Thanks 20 Spot!
author: holly B.

description:
Quaint little spot just opened about three months ago.
Daily Candy featured the opening of this neat spot.
Being a wine lover, 20 Spot quickly became my top check out spot.
The wine list was not as extensive as I thought it would but a good mix of mostly European wines.
The servers were also very willing to answer questions and let me tried different wine.
What surprised me pleasantly is the food here.
The tuna tar tar was served very sashimi style but decorated with flowers.
The rabbit was definitely intriguing as it was prepared as a pate....
Excellent flavor ~~!

Both the food menu and wine menu were small but fit perfectly well with the setting...
A cute spot in deed~~!!
author: YC L.

description:
20 Spot is a gem that I just recently came across. Intimate setting with dark-reddish lighting, this is a place to celebrate the end of a weekday, enjoy wine with your favorite people, a first date, or even a client. The fact that they did not take down the vintage, neon "RECORDS" signage in the front makes the place even more charming. 

The service staff are super friendly and attentive, so you never feel rushed. I also love that they are not overly crowded and you can actually talk to your table partners. The only two desserts they have are the vanilla panna cotta, and a chocolate pot de creme, and believe me, they are ridiculously delicious and sinful, and worth every bite. Portions are small and delicate, so make sure order a bunch of dishes from their menu. 

I would definitely return. Thank you 20 Spot, you've done the quiet neighborhood a nice deal!
author: Rika P.

description: What a cute little spot! Stopped in here for a glass of wine and just loved everything about it. Good wine, good lighting, great service and solid music.
author: Janette W.

description: Come here for expensive good bread and beer.  If you have any other expectation, you will be disappointed.  On the outside, you will have to squint to see 20 Spot.  I was outside and thought the place was Records.  The place is nicely decorated inside.  Nice long bar.  There's a blue red neon feeling inside.  Tables are solid wood.  Service is decently attentive.  Pork chop is soft.  The dips for the bread are interesting, but costly.
author: Byron L.

description: I'm pretty confident this is my favorite eatery in the lower 48 as of late. And this was before I found out blue jasmine was filmed upstairs. By far the best oysters I've tasted and the cheese plate tastes like heaven. . This place is right up my alley and cozy as can be. Kyle is a great bartender and the music and lighting were on fleek!
author: Laura H.

description: The staff was personable.... Very friendly.... and the food was amazing!! The restaurant felt like I arrived at an intimate dinner party! I appreciated how isolated the sound was! It's very rare to find a spot like this that isn't too loud and crowded!!! I love how intimate the place was and the food was spot on!! The balance of taste was amazing....every bite complimented  the next!
author: Paul B.

description:
Visit 20 Spot before it gets REALLY tough to snag a seat. It's chic, has great ambience, interesting wines and absolutely wonderful food. 
Try the grilled calamari, duck liver mousse, potted rabbit, steak tartare and all cheeses.
author: Coco M.

description:
In an old record store converted into a wine bar within the Mission District sits this savvy spot. Close to Valencia but not right on it, this location is actually be considered a bit hidden if you're not a local.

I remember this place for two things: an amusing bartender telling jokes I can't state here, and tasting their wine flights (the "20 Spot Flight") with friends during another visit. I do tend to like the Grenache, but that's the point of tasting a flight, isn't it?

There also some various foods to try (though I haven't yet), like oysters, deviled eggs and dungeness crab. Fun, relaxing and a bit more complex than your typical neighborhood hideout.
author: Garett T.

description:
I love the atmosphere, and the servers are nice.

But I don't like their wines. I don't think of myself as a wine snob, but I like the wine selection much better at, say, Etcetera than here. Most of the time I get a glass or share a bottle with a friend, the consensus is that it's just ok.

This would be fine if it were cheap, but of course it's not. So I don't go very often.
author: Jared B.

description:
My neighbourhood wine bar exceeds my expectations.  I love the 20 spot space--so fitting and fits nicely in it's small space.  I remember when Wood Allen was using this as a filming location (upstairs).  

I want a space that is both cozy, intimate and comfortable--that is a tall order I know. I appreciate their edited wines by the glass as well as their wines by the bottle list.  I have been here twice--though I live very close by--I found the service to be quite attentive.  I went her for a pre-dinner glass of wine and oysters--thoughtfully served.  If the oyster plate was so well done how might be the rest of the menu.  Look at photos I will try the food beyond oysters next time.

A well executed wine bar--attention to detail was done here superbly.
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description:
Cool spot, this 20 Spot. Great wine list and I definitely recommend the cheese plate.

We had no problem getting a table and it was a great atmosphere - not too loud either.

As with most wine bars, I wish the pours were a little more robust but I think I will just opt for buying a bottle next time. The oysters were my favorite - a great combination.
author: Joe C.

description: Lamb chop ... They said it's the best we'd ever taste bc that's what ppl told them. The ppl tell the TRUTH! Complimented with the crap and a wine flight. Chardonnay was especially great with the crab. Great mood music and ambiance. Give it a shot.
author: Rob A.

description: @20spot is awesome! Love vibe, wine & all delicious little nibbles. Pinot Gri was just right with deviled eggs & salmon & loads salty meats & cheeses. Went for private party last night. Perfect spot & going back ASAP!
author: heather s.

description:
Nice little place, very clean rebuild with great brickwork around the side. Excellent wines, and the cheese plate was nicely put together, with unique honey, jam, black walnuts and some mini-pickles accompanying the cheese. 

Keep an eye out for the Zoltron art before it sneaks up on you...scaaary :-)
author: Brian K.

description:
Excellent white wine choices, even if served a bit cold.  The reds were interesting but a fairly narrow flavor profile. 

The place has some amazing potential with a few caveats:

1) WAYYYY too loud.  It was actually difficult to carry out a conversation across a small table.

2) Better get there early, as it is a really small place.

3) This place is quickly going to be popular with the hipsters.

Overall, a win for the neighborhood and somewhere I will definitely re-visit.
author: Adam R.

description: Hey there, Cary Grant lookalike waitperson!  When you were so condescending last week to a couple of mild-mannered women regarding a question regarding wine and acidity, did you know you were talking (down) to a well-published, well-reviewed California food and wine writer and scholar?  No, it wasn't I (I wouldn't write that about myself), but my best friend, who deigns to Yelp so I'm doing it for the both of us.  The joke's on you, mister.  You would be well advised to educate yourself on the current debate among California winemakers and sommeliers regarding acidity in wine vis-á-vis the shaping of "California" wine identities.  If you had been privy to the ongoing professional discussion on the topic, you would have known better than to claim that all "California wine is acidic."  If you had known whom you were talking to, you would certainly not have been so condescending (for the record, you should be nice to ALL of your diners, even if they're asking you for White Zinfandel--lack of wine knowledge is not a character flaw, and people come into your establishment to have an enjoyable experience).  A couple other pointers:  1.  It's okay to bring people bread when they're sitting with a half plate of burrata--don't skimp on the toast, son; 2.  If a little fly lands on the wall behind a diner, please don't smash the bug against the wall behind her head and then smear the blood down the wall.  Unless you can suggest a good wine to pair with insect blood.
author: Kennau K.

description: A beautiful wine bar with a modernist american cuisine of small plates. lovely menu. I could come here every day and will never get old.
author: Les K.

description: Cute little wine bar. The atmosphere is very nice, relaxing, and it's a good place to go enjoy with your significant other. The servers are also very nice and enjoy making you feel welcomed.
author: Eduardo C.

description:
I love the decor and intimate atmosphere, and the service was excellent with personal attention from the lovely husband and wife owners.  

The menu is very eclectic. In all, we had oysters, the bread plate, olives and nuts, deviled eggs, hamachi, burrata and prosciutto, little gem lettuce, steak tartare and a selection of cheeses.  The burrata and prosciutto and the little gem lettuce were the best dishes.  We also worked our way through the wine list, the boys starting with bubbly - a Bernard Remy Chardonnay/Pino Noir and moving on to a Slovenian 2012 Furmint, a Suisun Valley 2013 Farmers Jane Field Blend and finally a Verdicchio from Ancona.  I tasted the Cote du Rhone just to see what a $9 wine tasted like.  Didn't care for it.  Moved on to the Crozes-Hermitage 2009 Syrah, then a Montefalco 2010 Sangiovese/Sagrantio and finally a Napa Valley 2012 Madigan Cabernet Sauvignon.  The buttermilk panna cotta with lemon curd and peaches was supremely delicious.  We had a lovely evening.  The bill, including tip, for three people was $330.
author: Lorraine F.

description: Loved the atmosphere and more importantly...the food! Perfect place for a night out with the girls.
author: Tara W.

description: Beautiful edible art is presented on each dish served and they taste even better than they look. It doesn't hurt that the venue happens to be charming, cozy, vintage and quirky in all the good ways with owner Bodhi spinning vinyl in honor of the old record store that used to live there. Bodhi also happens to have great taste in wine and will take you on a delicious and educational wine journey if you let him. The menu is smallish but with plenty of variety to make you happy and keep you interested in coming back as Chef Todd masterfully changes the menu dish by dish each week with the changing seasons. Chef only uses organic everything including top quality meats and fish and dairy. The menu seems to always have oysters, devilishly delicious deviled eggs, insane bread if you eat gluten (and worth breaking your abstinence for), a couple different salads, a unique burrata dish, a crudo or ceviche, steak tartare, roasted potatoes with a wicked tasty aioli, an amazing octopus dish and a melt in your mouth meat dish of some kind. Of course, the menu may change significantly come winter. I can't wait. It's my favorite date night spot.
author: KarenYaella F.

description: This place is pretty cozy and cute. The food can be a little heavy but the wine selection is decent.
author: elizabeth m.

description: Good spot. A little bright in my opinion but great nonetheless. Happy they're there to bring some nice wines to the block.
author: Lenny K.

description: This is a cute space with good service but the wine selection is sub-par.
author: Eater S.

description: I have a special place in my heart for 20 Spot. I stumbled upon this cozy, classy wine bar one day by chance and found myself imbibing in a glass or two (maybe 3) of really good wine. The manager, who I got to chatting with, was a total gem, as was the rest of the staff. All smiles, wonderful personality, the type of place you want to roll into after a long day of work to enjoy ambience, a fantastic glass of vino and light bites such as their amazing deviled eggs! 2 thumbs up!
author: S C.

description: Might be one of my favorite new spots. Cozy, great lighting, great vibe, friendly staff, and delicious food and drink!
author: M D.

description:
I loved this place. The food was really delicious, my sparkling wine was excellent, and we could actually have a conversation! I love a corner of the world where you can unwind and the noise level is reasonable. It's a rare find.
I have to highlight two things: the first is the bread. Really delicious. The second is the salad - you know that bright green, super fresh salad that tells you everything else will be good? That's the one. Finally, lots of gluten free, dairy free things to choose from, if you or someone in your group is picky. (In my group that would be me.)
author: D Z.

description: Good food, though a limited selection. Wine was tasty and Iberian. The service was perfect, no hanging on us & not far and distant. We had the chicken liver mousse, butternut squash soup, and black cod. All very good. Just a bit pricey. But then, this is the "hip" Mission. Worth a try though.
author: Erik T.

description: Great low key spot to grab a glass of wine and enjoy some good food. The staff is knowledgable about wine and the liver mousse that we had was excellent. We heard about it on Check Please Bay Area and it didn't disappoint. Only thing they could change is the decor which is a little confused.
author: Rachel P.

description: great atmosphere, super friendly staff, great drink menu and food options - all in all a winning formula.
author: Ruben K.

description: Every single thing is delicious including the desserts. Get the mussels and burrata though.
author: Loren A.

description: Love this place! Love the people! They care and everything they offer reflects the love and care and attention to stylish detail they put into this place! Cool and yummy. Come here for a good time.
author: Daydream Believer C.

description: It's a rather small tasting menu but everything on the menu was quite spectacular.  The deviled eggs were so creamy that it melted right on my tongue.  By far the best vegetable Ratatouille I've tasted in a very long time.  The vegetables were perfectly stewed and the sauce was tasty, savory, and paired fantastically with my exotic red wine.  Come early because this place gets extremely packed after 8pm.
author: Sharon N.

description: I almost hate to review this place because it's bound to get discovered eventually... I've been here probably around a dozen times since it opened. It is quite similar to my vision for what a perfect wine bar should be. The wines are beautiful and the owner's taste and recommendations are impeccable. (If Bodhi is there, always ask him what he's currently drinking.) The food is great - both for quick bites, and for dinner. The ambiance is cozy and friendly, the decor is interesting, and the music is good. It rarely gets crowded because it has no street presence. Go now before it's on everyone's radar!
author: Adam K.

description: Great food and service. I will be adding this place to the list of go-to restaurants. Try the soups...they also play a great variety of music. Good place to take a lady on a first date...or any date no matter how long you have been together:
author: Hamza S.

description: We had our doubts based on the dollar signs Yelpers have assigned this place, but it really was delicious, no corners cut, and the service is spectacular too. We'll make an excuse to come here for a light dinner/primarily of wine more often.
author: Caroline C.

description: The oysters and grilled calamari here are very special. The wine list is also. Grab your besties and a few hours; you'll be glad you did.
author: Rachel S.

description: We were there on Halloween just last week and the food was spot on amazing! A bit hard to find but well worth it - cool atmosphere - cool music - awesome food.
author: Manny D.

description:
There really needs to be a 2.5 star selection. I wouldn't say the entire experience was "Meh", but I'm not feeling the "A-OK" option either. I've been here twice. Once for dinner and drinks and once for a drink at the bar. The food was really very good. Surprising actually. It was fresh- distinct flavors and great presentation with little treats all over the plates we shared. 

However, when I took my husband back for a before-dinner drink we had a disappointing experience. One reason why we live in San Francisco is because of the amazing food and drink options and in a town so saturated with amazing spots, I don't know how places get away with bad service. We were served by the owner, no less. He barely gave us the time of day. He said no more than five words to us and was too busy drinking bubbly with some friends to notice if we needed anything. This was disappointing for such a cute, quaint little joint...I'll reconsider going back...bummer!
author: Robyn A.

description: The 20 spot is a great place to go and have good wine, great company, and yummy bites to eat while in the Mission. The staff is always amazing and will always give good recommendations on the current wine selection. The ambiance is very relaxing. They even play good music from vinyl. Highly recommended!
author: Brian M.

description: Lovely historic setting and waitstaff made us feel like family. Ambience, wine quality, and the delicious smorgasbord of appetizers were all excellent. Looking forward to my next visit.
author: Emily V.

description: 3 beers and 3 wines on tap.  25 wines available by the glass.  About 110 wines by the bottle.  Take a look inside the Force of Habit record shop, and record shop it is no more!   Its now a snazzy new Mission wine bar.  It was great to check out the space and see the awesome little layout.  There are various intimate seating areas.  The furniture is super trendy and the behind the bar is a huge intricate system for storing the bazillion wines they have.  The food is top-notch wine bar fare - oysters, clever salads, sandwiches and fancy cheeses.  This is going to be one of the Mission's hottest new little night spots for wine lovers.  Great addition to the SF night scene! :-)
author: Jaydee B.

description: A friend & I stopped in on the second night it was open and it was PACKED! OUr server, Marc, knew his wines really well--he just asked what kind of wine we typically liked and brought us both tastes of very different wines that we both liked. Very cool interior, excellent wine choices by the glass and an even larger selection by the bottle. We didn't have the food, but the people next to us did and it looked great. My guess is this will quickly become a Mission hotspot. A tip: Get there early if you want a table and look for the neon "Records" sign outside.
author: N B.

description: My new favorite spot! Great service, GORGEOUS food plating, amazing food. Mega win all around.
author: Amber K.

description:
The most enjoyable part of our meal was poking fun at the restaurant.  We were told before we came that "40% of their menu was vegetarian." Not!!  We particularly got a good laugh when we were told, when asked what was vegetarian on the menu, that the bread and butter and olives/nuts were good options.We were told by staff beforehand that "We always have a salad and roasted potatoes with sauce mornay," neither of which were on the menu. The roasted king trumpet mushrooms, while tasty and priced like a full meal, was smaller than a tapa.

The cheese plate was quite good - but there is not much you can do wrong with a cheese plate.

The burrata beet salad had to be returned; it was difficult to find the tiny beets buried under the plate of mashed cheese.

And... this was one of the noisiest restaurants we've been in.

On the positive side, the wait staff were attentive, friendly and tried hard to please.

To conclude, this is really a wine bar with a few light snacks and limited options of small portion main dishes. Don't expect to make a full meal out of it.  Unfortunately you will have already paid for a full meal by the time you leave, but  the good news is you can go around the corner and get a great burrito or a fantastic dosa for a fraction of the price. 20 Spot needs to decide what it wants to be: either provide a real dinner menu or just provide the bar bites and price them accordingly.
author: Joseph S.

description: A wonderful bar with great service and a good ambiance. It was bustling till about 11:30-a nice little spot to have a good ol' time!
author: Vivek N.

description: Great new spot in the Mission. They have done a great job with the wine selection and the small plates. Definitely worth a trip for all.
author: Dilly M.

description: Very rude waitress. We asked her to lower the music that suddenly started playing at an uncomfortably loud level. She told us "it was a bar". But she forgot that this is a sit-down "beer and wine only" place that also serves food. So, actually this is more of a restaurant! She completely ignored us when we so nicely asked her to lower it a second time. I'm tired of rude wait staff in the Mission so I'm starting to call them all out on their crap. It's not our fault you're mad at the world! Get a grip!
author: Den M.

description: I have been meaning to sit down and write a review of our experience at 20 spot.  First, the space is amazing.  They did such a great job on every detail.  The wine list, fantastic.  I would expect nothing else from the owner of our favorite Russian Hill wine bar.  The food, light, refreshing, packed with flavor.  We tried a sampling of a good percentage of the menu.  Oysters, so fresh and delicious sauces on the side.  The cheese place was beautiful and every element added a punch.  I especially loved the pickled vegetables. The razor clams, a first for me, were amazing.  I could have eaten 5 more plates of them!  Every dish had such care and so much flavor.  Great spot!
author: Jaime C.

description: I really enjoyed my experience here- love the decor and ambiance, and the owner was very friendly and welcoming.  I only had wine and the cheese plate, so I can't comment on the other dishes, but the cheese plate was the most generous cheese plate I've ever had.  The servings of cheese were larger than any I've ever gotten elsewhere, and it came with plenty of bread, fruit, almonds, pickled veggies, honey, and a fruit spread.  Would definitely go back to try more wines and some of the other dishes.
author: Audrey T.

description:
Excellent wines, amazing food. Had a great chat with John about many things, including grat wines and food pairings.

Tried the Hamachi and the plate of bread. I still can't believe the quality of the bread they serve, and that it's just $4.
author: X O.

description: First time.  You will likely spend a lot more than a 20 spot, but you will have some great drink, eats, and excellent service.  The staff is obviously happy doing what they do.  Cool atmosphere.  We had the Hamachi, Trumpet Mushroom, Beets and Burrata, and one other dish.  All were very good, but the Trumpet mushroom was my favorite.
author: Alex R.

description: My favorite wine bar in the Mission, without a doubt!
author: Olivia B.

description: My new favorite wine bar!!  Love the atmosphere, food and wine.
author: Tom F.

description: Great service, romantic ambiance (a little loud, though), and fantastic wine. Intimate and low key; would come here again.
author: Krystine D.

description: I don't write reviews often, but this place is AMAZiNG! The food, the wine list, the atmosphere are all tops. Just come.
author: Jenny C.

description: Fun place to be. Loved the ambiance. Our waitress was more than helpful, offering great choices and giving us a few extras. Really looking forward to going back. Great beer and wine selection, loved the cheese plate and the olives were some of the best I've ever had. Tucked away nicely between the crowds on Valencia and mission.
author: Daniel P.

description: 20th Spot is such a sweet wine bar! The selection is great, and the small plates they serve are carefully curated and prepared. The cheese plates are very reasonable in price and generous in portions. I love the mid-century furniture they have, and they have done a great job of creating different spaces in the restaurant that serve various purposes. For example, you can curl up on the couch for more intimate conversations, sit at the bar with a good book, or come in with a group and have a lively discussion around the table. The staff are warm and extremely knowledgeable--they know about their wine and they want to share their expertise.
author: Belinda S.

description: The menu looked great, but the food didn't meet the expectations unfortunately.  Even the bone marrow, usually one of my favorites, wasn't that great.  The cheese plate was meh. :(
author: Allan G.

description: Really cute spot!. Perfect for a pre/post-dinner drink or a light meal.
author: Natalia A.

description: Celebrated my birthday here with a small group of friends and had a wonderful experience. Great venue and staff was super nice, very thoughtful in their wine recommendations and extremely accommodating as our group switched tables halfway through. I would recommend 20 Spot for any occasion, especially for smaller group hangouts.
author: Eva R.

description: Great neighborhood spot. Good wine selection and enough of a beer selection too. Cheese plate has great accompaniments. Excellent and attentive service!
author: Christine P.

description: Definitely hip, small and cute.  The staff were super nice.  Food is more snacks versus meal (we went nearby to get a full dinner afterwards).  I wish they had some remnants or design inside to show it used to be record store..  I thought that was the coolest part, but you'd never know it from the inside.
author: Melanie C.

description:
Very nice interior, I loved the wine, the service was good, what we ate was tasty if a little lite size-wise.

I have to knock off a star because it is LOUD. So loud that the server didn't hear our order and brought us the wrong thing. I was hoarse afterwards from shouting to be heard by my friends and we were close to each other. I feel bad writing it because I have no idea how they could change the acoustics and it's an otherwise lovely space.

I would go back but only with my husband as I can guess what he's saying most of the time anyway :p
author: Odette L.

description: for what it is, a small, intimate little bar/restaurant, its perfect.  we tried wines they recommended at the bar and the cali cheese plate. overall, a nice place to take someone for a classy nite in the new mission.
author: Roy N.

description: The burratta salad was outstanding and the server had great pairing suggestions.  It was a little hot inside (on a hot night), but worth it for a lovely evening!
author: Laura V.

description: My favorite little wine bar in the mission!  Great vibe that is both chill and fun, perfect for dates!  Great wine, and food is amazing too!  Try the cheese plate, deviled eggs and oysters!
author: Dun W.

description: Great food, atmosphere, wine and beer list. Really well appointed with cool art. Met the owner who is surprisingly articulate, when you consider that he looks a tad on the residentially challenged side.
author: Jeremy P.

description: Fabulous! Cool atmosphere tasty Spanish wines. Friendly. Quiet location.
author: Josh F.

description:
Have been here several times now and thought it time to share its goodness (& hope this doesn't backfire into me not getting the coveted Eames rocking chair spot in the window on a busy night). 
I have come here both alone and brought in friends and outa-towners many of which are in the industry. The consensus: deftly curated wines in a cozy-artistic-funky-musical setting with unique and delicious small plates/ smaller hot dishes. Seriously, the attention to detail is something to behold. Even the WC is dope. Their crew is fun and attentive and will definitely help you choose the right wine for the right moment/mood/dish. The menu changes up a bit, too. The clams and pearls is one of my current favorites and always the burrata, oh and the house cured caviar, delicate! Deserts always hit the spot (get it).  It gets busy so check it out on one of their quieter nights or  if you can swing it early, they have a happy hour on wines, win-win. Just don't get in my Eames chair!
author: Vic R.

description: This is a place I would recommend highly to anyone. Small intimate layout, records playing, amazing art, such friendly hospitality, and fantastic food and wine. We asked about multiple wines (all of which we got tastings of before pouring) and they definitely get out of the big bold CA red styles. The food...don't even get me started....must haves are the crab pot and pork chop. We declined dessert but the guy helping us as we ate at the bar (owner we think?) gave us small pours of sweet Riesling for free before we left. I would 100% go here and recommend it to all of my friends!!
author: Ashley G.

description: definitely a fan of this place. Service was wonderful, wine list was really great and the pork soup was delicious! Gluten and Dairy free so extra good in my eyes!
author: Natalia M.

description: A wine bar that introduced me to new wines and has good food? Count me in. The waitress was knowledgeable and pointed us in the right direction - I tried a red from Mendocino that delivered like a Pinot Noir, exactly as she claimed it would and the buttermilk panna cotta was great, too.
author: JJ C.

description: Used to be a loyal patron of 20 Spot until I was denied service one Saturday night for having an out of state ID. The new manager on duty claimed my NY drivers license seemed 'flimsy' and refused to serve me and my friends. What a big day for this tiny overpriced wine bar to have an out of state patron! It's unfortunate this place will likely go out of business should this manager continue to turn away patrons who don't have a California ID.
author: Penny L.

description: You'll want to go here for a glass of wine, but you'll end up ordering dinner.  Great wines, and really amazing food!  The Bean Salad was so fresh and tasty that we ordered bread to soak up the olive oil.   The cheese plate was great, but  you'll need to save room for desert!  The chocolate pudding with meringue was absolutely yummy!  So happy to have found this neighborhood hangout.
author: Kellie M.

description: 20 Spot has quickly become my favorite destination in the Mission. This place has nailed it on every level: great atmosphere, amazing wine selection, delicious food, and top notch customer service! Perfect place to grab a drink and a bite or enjoy a leisurely dinner.
author: Whitney B.

description: I absolutely love this little place! The decor is warm and cozy, but the vibe is chill! I was blown away by the delicious wines, particularly the unusual  white wines by the glass, including a yummy Marsanne Rousanne from California. The food is also great - though the menu is somewhat limited,.  We've had hamachi and avocado, mussels in whte wine, creamy burratta with asparagus, and  an amazing chocolate dessert.  The service is warm, friendly, and professional.  Can't wait to go back.
author: allison s.

description: One on the most amazing meals I've had in years.  A good friend of mine took my to 20 Spot to celebrate my birthday   I wasn't expecting much.   But to my surprise it was better than great.  We shared my absolute favorite oyster "Boh Solei".  Small, super flavorful, slightly briny, not creamy, and served with a homemade hot sauce and vinegaret.  Pared with some bubbly champaign suggested by a lovely host Bodhi Then we shared King Trumpet Mushrooms with artichokes and a Bernaisse Sauce which was out of this world party in your mouth good, pared with a lovely Pinot.  Our next dish was a potted crab which was a pot of cleaned succulent crab ready to eat. No mess, and served with perfectly toasted crusty French bread. It was so YUM!  Oh and the salad of baby fresh crispy hearts of Jem leaves with a fresh mozzarella cheese was divine.  I was full but wanted to try the soup which was our last dish. The butter bean soup with chunks of bacon (the candy of meats). It was was amazing. Of course more wine,  a Cab Franc which I loved.  Deserts because it was my birthday... but there wasn't room left to eat it.  If you haven't been there you are in for a treat!  It a great place to get Amazing Food in a a comfortable great atmosphere with a lovely host "Bodhi", who knows his wines and a place.  Ladies this would be a place I would feel comfortable going by myself   It was warm and inviting yet chic.  I definitely will be going back with another friend.  Such a "Jem" in and unexpected venue.  Don't miss this one!   Oh ... and I am super picky.  KK
author: Kyra K.

description:
the seafood salad sparkled with freshness of the raw tuna, lightly smoked salmon, perfect shrimp, with mussels and adventurous uni on a light avocado mousse.
oysters on the half shell, a separate dish, was accompanied by both a cocktail sauce and a delicious unusual relish of tiny dice of vinegary apple, which was a nice contrast in both taste and texture to the oyster. the vegetable salad offered a delicious mix of  seasonal fresh and dehydrated veggies- tomato, eggplant, pepper with a light house made farmer cheese.the wine menu meets fine wine bar expectations, and the servers offer a small pour to taste and be sure you like it before filling your glass. 
worth trying and coming back to..again..and again!
author: Susana M.

description: Nice cozy wine bar. Good food and wine selection. Especially, we like an ambiance there. It made us feel comfortable! All of us enjoyed the night there and good people except only one waitress. She was always in a rush to clear all plates, no smile, unfriendly. Unfortunately, this was a big minus for our Friday night.
author: Masayuki M.

description: love it! the bar bites are top notch as is tgeir drink selection. i love the atmosphere and neighborhood feel. xo.
author: Best M.

description: Super friendly place. Knowledgable staff, good beer. Quiet. This is a great place to bring a date, or drink with friends.
author: Klevin D.

description: Great first date spot or hang w/ pals and actually hear each other spot. Cozy - not too hipster-y. Excellent small but unique wine list. First-rate service. Snacky snacks are little inconsistent but I appreciate the healthier wine bar offerings. And I dig the tunes.
author: Carson R.

description: Super charming with delicious wines! The staff is amazing and incredibly friendly. Perfect hangout spot.
author: Mark Z.

description: Super awesome space, friendly vibe, good wines and excellent tunes.  A winner.
author: Todd S.
